loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is married and has children who attend school. 

Mwanakombo has run a cereals store for a year. Her husband helped her gather the money. She has a good customer base.

She is requesting a loan to buy noodles, flour, different types of oil, cookies, cassava, beverages, sweets and different types of meat to sell in her store. She will be able to offer her clients a wider variety, which will result in a higher income. She appreciates the opportunity she has because it will be useful, not only for her but also for her family.

loans.use: to buy noodles, flour, different types of oil, cookies, cassava, beverages, sweets

loans.name: Barrio De Santa Cruz Group

texts.es: Armando es originario de una comunidad cuyo atractivo es que se encuentra como a unos 3 kilómetros una zona arqueológica que año con año llegan turistas de todo el mundo a ver lo grandioso de los antepasados. Armando es parte de un grupo nuevo llamado Barrio de Santa Cruz, ya que en su colonia se encuentra una cruz muy grande en un cerro. Platica que hicieron un grupo para pedir un crédito para mejorar sus negocios y porque él quiere hacer crecer su negocio el cual tiene en casa y su esposa le ayuda a atenderlo entre semana  porque el sale a trabajar como albañil a diario a otras localidades y le toca vender los fines de semana. Desde hace un año tienen un puesto de venta de papas doradas, papas a la francesa, chicharrones preparados, churros preparados con salsa y diferentes tipos de frituras, las cuales compra en una tienda de una población cercana a su localidad llamada Zitacuaro porque ahí le dan más baratas las frituras. Dice que su sueño es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia ya que tiene 4 hijos dos estudian la primaria, una en el preescolar y un recién nacido, dice que su sueño es ampliar su negocio y más adelante vender un poco de abarrotes y hacerle un local bien establecido en su casa para su esposa. Los demás integrantes de su grupo se llaman Yeimi, Fidelina, Karen Iveth, María Guadalupe y Juan Manuel, ellos invertirán sus créditos en el negocio de elaboración de bolsas tejidas, elaboración de servilletas, en la compra de gallinas y cerdos.
texts.en:
Armando is a native of a community located 3 kilometers from an archaeological site that year after year attracts tourists from all over the world who want to see the greatness of his ancestors. Armando is part of a new group called Barrio de Santa Cruz named for a huge cross on a hill in his community.  He says that they put this group together to request a loan so they can improve their businesses and because he wants to grow his home business.  His wife helps him tend to the business during the week because he also works everyday as a mason.  He tends to the sales on the weekends. They have been selling roasted potatoes, French fries, chicharrones [fried pork rinds], churros [donuts] made with different types of fruit and sauce.  He buys his products from a store in a town close to his called Zitacuaro because they sell him the fruits at a cheaper price. He says that his dream is to improve his family’s living conditions since he has 4 children, 2 in elementary school, 1 in preschool and a newborn, and to expand his business and eventually sell a few groceries so that his home business becomes well established for his wife. 

The other members of the group are Yeimi, Fidelina, Karen Iveth, María Guadalupe and Juan Manuel. They will invest their loan money in their businesses making woven blouses and tablecloths and to purchase chickens and pigs.

loans.use: purchase fruit and soy to make vegetables, sauces and soft drinks.

loans.name: Felizarda

texts.en:
Felizarda is a 52-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fishing business for 30 years now together with her husband. This is the only source of her income.
Felizarda is requesting a loan to buy fish hooks, fish nets and nylon string, all materials used in catching fish. Through the help of this loan, she will be able to buy these materials for catching fish and selling it to her local community.
In the future, Felizarda hopes to expand her business. She also dreams to buy anew boat.

loans.use: to buy fish hooks, fish nets, nylon string

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Elma works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling charcoal and firewood in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling Avon products, farming sugarcane and a general store. Elma is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional firewood and sacks of charcoal to sell for her business buying and selling charcoal and firewood.

Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional firewood and sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Marvin Eduardo

texts.es:
Marvin es un joven de 22 años de edad, el está en unión simple con su esposa y vive en Sololá, el tiene un hijo varón de cuatro años de edad.
El es un emprendedor quien se dedica a la panadería   la cual ha sido su principal fuente de ingresos familiares esto lo aprendió cuando trabajo con unos familiares aprendiendo a elaborar pan esto le dio lugar para hacer la apertura de su propio negocio.
Ahora el tiene  cinco años de experiencia en este negocio y sirviéndole a sus clientes en la comunidad obteniendo ganancias aceptables para poder  crecer más su negocio  
De esta manera el solicita un préstamo  Q 8,500.00  comprando materia prima para la elaborar  pan ofreciendo  mayor calidad y variedad a sus clientes quienes lo prefieren, así mismo  seguir ampliando su panadería obteniendo mejores ganancias cada día.
Su mayor sueño es terminar de construir su hogar para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Marvin is 22 years old, married and living in Sololá.  He has a four year old son.  Marvin is an entrepreneur with a bakery, which has been the family's main income.  He learned this trade from his family and learning to make bread gave him the chance to start his own business.

He now has five years experience with his business and serving his customers in the community.  He earns an acceptable amount for his business to grow more.

With this in mind he is applying for a loan of 8500 Qetzal to buy supplies for making bread, offering better quality and more variety to the customers that prefer to buy from Marvin.  This will allow the business to grow with better profits every day.

Marvin's biggest dream is to finish building his house so as to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials for a bakery.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is a 34-year-old married man from Bohol, Philippines and the father of three young children. He is a fisherman and has been in the fishing business for more than five years now.

Pedro is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets. With this, he will be able to enhance his daily catch. In the future, Pedro hopes to make his business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is 52 years old and married with one child. Rizalina works very hard to provide for her family.
Rizalina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.
Rizalina has had this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, detergent, diapers, canned goods and other groceries.
In the future Rizalina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Elsa works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and farming rice. Elsa is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like, rice, oil, can goods, etc. in her general store.

Elsa has been sustaining her business activities with her past 21 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as rice, oil, can goods, etc. for her general store.

loans.name: Karina Jessenia

texts.es:
Karina vive en Libertad, tiene 24 años. Comenzó su negocio vendiendo comidas rápidas en la esquina de su casa con la mamá y desde ese entonces le fue gustando y decidió poner un restaurante. 

El trabajo lo realiza con la mamá y un chico que le ayuda a servir. La dificultad que vive día a día es la de los ladrones y que algunos clientes se van sin antes pagar la comida.

Es una mujer totalmente soltera, no tiene hijos así que se mantiene sola y sola sigue adelante. Ayudando a su  mamá si lo necesita.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azucar, legumbres, granos, frutas para poder presparar mas almuerzos. En el futuro quiere poder obtener un restaurante en el centro de la ciudad donde le resulta más efectivo la venta de almuerzos y meriendas.
texts.en:
Karina, 24, lives in Libertad.  She started her business selling fast-food with her mother on the corner where her house is and since then has enjoyed it and decided to open a restaurant.  She works with her mother and a young man who helps her wait on customers.  Her daily difficulty is robbers and some of the customers who leave without paying for their food.  She’s a single woman with no children so she supports herself by herself and continues forward by herself too helping her mother out as needed.

She wants to use the loan to buy sugar, vegetables, grains and fruit in order to be able to make more lunches.  In future, she wants to be able to get a restaurant in city center where lunch and dinner sales are more profitable.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her restaurant.

loans.name: Rophus

texts.en: Rophus has been doing well and his business has expanded greatly. He now owns a second store to sell coconuts and he has applied for his fifth loan to buy more stock of coconuts. He hopes that his business grows and he is able to expand up to Mombasa County. This would to enable him to have a better income and to educate his children up to the university level.

loans.use: to buy more stock of coconuts.

loans.name: Ton's Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched-roof house in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Cambodia, Ton is 50 years old and married. She has four children. She and her husband are rice farmers, who have been farming on 1 hectare of farmland to make their living for 32 years. With her current harvests, she is able to earn about KHR 9,000 per day to meet the family’s needs.

Ton’s group consists of two members who live in the same village and this is in her first loan with VisionFund. Now leading her group to seek for a loan of KHR 150,000 each, Ton will use her portion to buy materials for constructing a decent latrine. She'll need cement, bricks, a latrine pan, etc. She hopes this loan will enable her family to have a clean latrine for daily which will improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to construct a decent latrine.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married. She is 67 years old and lives in Makawa, Aloran Misamis Occidental, Philippines.
To earn a living, Teresita has a piggery. She has had this business for 13 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 15, 000. She has requested a loan to purchase more feed for her pigs. Teresita has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.
In the future, Teresita hopes to be able to increase her savings.

loans.use: to purchase more feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface sells charcoal in Nairobi. He is 34 years old and single. He has been in this business for seven years now and it has been profitable. Apart from selling retail to locals, he also supplies the charcoal to various hotels and schools.

This is his first loan and he plans to use the amount to buy more stock of charcoal for sell. He wants to have enough stock so that he can meet the high demand from his customers. This will also enable him to make more income with which he will use to expand his business.

Boniface hopes to open another charcoal selling business and thereby make more income and also employ workers to sell and supply charcoal.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new freezer to make ice and sweet ice.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a 37-year-old, married man with five children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a retail shop where he sells new clothes. He also grows cocoa and has now started the retail shop, so as to meet his family's daily expenses since his other work is seasonal. Price fluctuations and ever-changing customer preferences affect the business, while his plan is to own a modern boutique. 

Samson intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Prong's Group

texts.en:
Prong is a 52-year-old, married father who lives in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province. He has seven children. He and his wife have been in rice farming and vegetable planting for 32 years. The family's daily income is about 18,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan for Prong with VisionFund Cambodia. Now he is leading his group to ask for a loan of 160,000 KHR each. As the leader, Prong is going to use his portion to buy materials for constructing a decent latrine. He'll need cement, bricks, a latrine pan, etc. He hopes this loan will enable his family to have a clean latrine for daily use, so as to provide a healthy standard of living.

loans.use: To buy materials for constructing a decent latrine

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 47 años es soltera y no tiene hijos ya que se dedicó a cuidar a sus padres y su familia ,actualmente vive junto a sus hermanas en la casa de sus padres.El trabajo de Rosa, consiste en la venta de abarrotes, a diario o cada dos días se dirige al mercado mayorista de la ciudad en donde hace las compras necesarias para volver a surtir su negocio con los productos que se terminaron en los dias anteriores. Trabaja siempre con el lema : “trata bien al cliente, bríndale lo que necesita y ten todo lo que busca para que vuelva siempre” es por eso que ella no se descuida y siempre está abastecida con todo lo necesario para vender. Su negocio esta en su casa , lleva realizando esta labor casi 4 años.Le gusta mucho su actividad laboral pues le permite tener tiempo para realizar algunas otras ectividades en su hogar, tiene muchos planes a futuro pero el principal consiste en  mejorar la infraestructura de su local de ventas.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1700 soles para comprar mercaderia para su negocio tales como leche , condimentos, gaseosas, azucar entre otros,además está muy comprometida a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas .
texts.en:
Rosa, 47 years old, is single and does not have children since she has dedicated herself to taking care of her parents and her family. Currently, she lives with her sisters in her parents’ house. 

Rosa’s work consists of grocery sales. Every day or every two days she walks to the wholesale market in the city, where she makes the purchases necessary to return to supply her business with the products that have recently run out. She always works with the motto: “treat the customer well, provide what is needed and have everything the customer is searching for so that he always returns.” It is because of this that she does not neglect herself and always is always supplied with everything necessary to sell.

Her business is in her house. She has worked at this for almost four years. She likes her work so much since it allows her to have time to do some other activities in her home. She has many plans for the future but the principal one consists of improving the infrastructure of her store. 

This time, she will request 1700 soles to buy merchandise for her business such as milk, condiments, soda, and sugar, among others. Furthermore, she is very committed to completing her payments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like milk, sodas, condiments, among others.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin has cleared his previous loan owing to last season's large harvest. He has used the proceeds to diversify to animal rearing. He has acquired another loan from KADET LTD., of 90,000 KES which will facilitate buying more livestock for fattening and sell later at a profit.

He plans to used the increased proceeds to build the family a permanent house as well as to pay school fees for his children.

His dream is to own a large maize plantation and manage large scale farming.

loans.use: to buy more livestock for fattenning and resale

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie works hard to support seven children. She is a widow and has a buy and sell broom business in the Philippines.

Elsie requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a Solar lamp.  She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a backup light in case of an emergency.

Elsie is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Dorcy

texts.en:
This is Dorcy. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the materials needed for her tailoring business. She makes curtains and also does some repairing. She with the help of her children works hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan to buy supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and gratitude in her heart.

Dorcy simply dreams to live happily with her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Gebie

texts.en: Gebie is 44 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Gebie has been farming sugarcane for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock. Gebie is borrowing 23,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farming materials. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farming materials

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en:
Emilio, 39 years old, is married to a government employee. They are blessed with three children. They are currently residing at the village of San Antonio. 

Emilio is into selling dura boxes (plastic cabinets) in different towns of Isabela. He's been into this business for almost 2 years and earns an income of 10,000 PHP a month. These plastic cabinets are used as containers of clothes at home. Emilio would like to avail a loan amounting to 35,000 PHP to purchase plastic cabinets or dura boxes to sell. He's hoping that his loan will be granted so that he can able to use his capital to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase plastic cabinets to sell

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is 52 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school.

Renato is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Renato requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Renato has been farming vegetables for six years now, and has borrowed eleven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Renato would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 33 years old and lives in Bolibol, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. 

Marilou has a general store business and earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase more stock such as soap, shampoo, sugar, salt, vinegar and coffee for her general store business. 

Marilou has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Marilou hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as soap, shampoo, sugar, salt, vinegar and coffee for her general store business

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is married and has 4 children.  She is 50 years old and lives in Bolibol, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living, Minda has a general store business. She has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns approximately 5,000 PHP. She has requested a loan to purchase more stock such as shampoo,toothpaste, soap, vinegar, sugar and salt for her general store business.  Minda has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.

In the future, Minda hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, vinegar, sugar and salt for her general store business

loans.name: Maridel

texts.en:
Maridel is married with four children. Maridel is 52 years old and lives in Talic, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Maridel has been engaged in a business selling dried fish for almost 3 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more stock of dried fish for her retail business. Maridel has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  

In the future, Maridel hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dried fish for her retail business

loans.name: Lory Jane

texts.en:
Lory Jane works hard to support three children. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Lory Jane requested a 1,800 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a Solar lamp.  She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Lory Jane is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the steps necessary to obtain his professional degree.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
This is Nancy. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy many gallons of water. She was able to also finance her other business of direct selling and food vending. As a widow, she is working hard to provide income for her household's everyday expenses. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and gallons of mineral water needed for her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nancy hopes that all her businesses will grow and dreams to give her children a good life and a future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and gallons of mineral water needed to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Kristina

texts.en:
Kristina is a 25-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, two children, who go to the local kindergarten, and her retired mother-in-law. Her husband is working as a workman (artisan) and has a small monthly income. 

The family has one milking cow. They milk the cow and produce cheese. In addition, the family has a plot of land where they sow potatoes. The harvested product and the cheese are sold at the local market. Kristina is very young and a hardworking woman who has a great desire to get ahead. She wants to develop her business to make her family life better. Kristina wants a loan to buy calves and after raising them, sell as meat at the local market. This will increase her income and she will reinvest the profit in the same business. Kristina awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase calves to sell as meat

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 67 years old and lives in Canicapan Clarin,Mis.Occ.,Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

To earn a living, Remedios has a business selling snacks in the community. She earns about 3,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. Remedios has requested a loan to purchase more bread, banana-que (deep fried banana with caramelized sugar), etc. for snack vending.

Remedios has been a member of PMPC for 17 years.  In the future, Remedios would like to save money in case of any future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more bread, banana-que,etc. for snack vending

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Elenita works hard to support her family.  She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Elenita is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

Elenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring business

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a very hard working and determined gentleman who owns a motorbike. He is married and has 10 children. He has been in business for the past four years. He used his previous loan to buy a motorcycle. His business did very well and he repaid his loan. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to buy a motorbike.

Someday he hopes to have a fleet of motorbikes and educate his children up to the university level. He requires a loan of 20,857 KES to pay school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Norma works hard to support her family.

She has a dressmaking business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening and farming rice.  Norma is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase thread, fabrics, and other materials for her dressmaking business.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase thread, fabrics, and other materials for making dresses

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married with six children. Evelyn is 52 years old and lives in Dulapo, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Evelyn sells fish to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.

Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for six years.  In the future, Evelyn hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Estrellas Group

texts.es: Clementina es una mujer alegre, trabajadora, atenta y muy responsable, tiene 61 años y es originaria de una comunidad es rica en bosques de pino y oyamel la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la cría de borregos y al cultivo de aguacate ya que el clima es prolifero para su producción. Doña Clemen, como es conocida, tiene un grupo llamado Estrellas, las cuales son muy trabajadoras las integrantes aunque últimamente han tenido una mala racha como platica doña Clementina “hace poco una sobrina que era parte de nuestro grupo se enfermo le detectaron leucemia y la verdad es muy doloroso ver a mi sobrina en mal estado, ahorita gracias a Dios ya la está librando le han estado haciendo quimioterapias, me siento triste verla así porque ella era una mujer muy sana y con muchos proyectos de vida y de la noche a la mañana se puso mal y tuvieron que internarla en un hospital de Morelia para poder curarla, ahorita pedimos a Dios por su pronta recuperación y estamos ayudándola para que salga mas rápido de su enfermedad”. Clementina se dedica al cultivo de aguacate y a criar borregos y gallinas en su casa dice que tiene un terreno muy amplio y su esposo y ella le echan muchas ganas para sacar adelante a su único hijo adolescente el cual estudia el último semestre de preparatoria. Ella dice “con mucho esfuerzo estamos sacando a nuestro hijo adelante yo no tengo dinero para dejarle como herencia pero eso si le voy a dejar su estudio para que salga adelante solo en la vida, y si quiera el me está respondiendo con buenas calificaciones”. Clemen, tiene un huerto de más de 80 árboles de aguacate los cuales en temporada de corta ella sale a venderlos a la central de abastos por cubetas porque así le pagan un poco más. Ahorita está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de abono, fertilizantes, insecticidas y calidra para pintar sus árboles y así no se le suban las plagas y se den los frutos en buenas condiciones. Dice que su sueño es tener un gran huerto y un gran gallinero ya que le gusta los animales y las plantas. Las otras cuatro integrantes del grupo se llaman María Angélica, María Trinidad, Mayra y Refugio ellos invertirán sus créditos en la compra de insumos para cultivo de aguacates, en la compra de dulces para su venta y en la compra de ropa para su venta.
texts.en:
Clementina is a cheerful, hard-working, attentive and very responsible woman. She's 61 years old and comes from a community that is rich in pine and "oyamel" forests, and where the majority of residents work in sheep breeding and avocado cultivation, for which the weather is favorable. 

Doña Clemen, which is how she's known, leads a group called Estrellas, made up of very hard-working women. They have gone through a rough time lately because, as Doña Clementina tells, "my niece, who was part of our group, got sick recently and was diagnosed with leukemia. It's really painful to see her suffer, although she's already having chemotherapy, thank goodness. I feel sad to see her this way because she was a very healthy woman with many life projects and suddenly got sick and had to be taken into a hospital in Morelia. We now ask God for her prompt recovery and are helping her to overcome her illness faster."

Clementina makes a living cultivating avocado and breeding sheep and chickens in her house. She says they have a large piece of land and she and her husband put a lot of enthusiasm in it to provide for their only child, who is a teenager and attends his last semester of high-school. She says that they are being able to support him with a lot of effort and that, although she doesn't have money to leave in bequest, she's supporting his studies to help him get ahead in life. He's responding with good grades. 

Clemen has a crop with over 80 avocado trees and, during harvest season, she sells them at the supplies' market in buckets so that she makes a bit more money. She's now requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide and "calidra" to paint her trees to avoid plagues and get the fruit in good condition. She says her dream is to have a big crop and a big henhouse, as she likes animals and plants. The other four members of the group are María Angélica, María Trinidad, Mayra and Refugio, and they will use their loans to buy supplies for the avocado cultivation, as well as sweets and clothes for sale.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the avocado crop, such as fertilizer and insecticide, and food for the chickens.

loans.name: Jesley

texts.en:
Jesley is 35 years old and married.

Jesley is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jesley requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and pigs.

She has been raising pigs for six years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jesley would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and pigs.

loans.name: Bartholomew

texts.en:
Bartholomew, also known as Bartolo for short, is from the village of Big Falls, on the Southern highway of Belize. As a program manager at a local conservation NGO in the district, he is also involved in promoting cacao production in agroforestry systems. According to Bartholomew, he got involved in cacao because it contributes to environmental health and social well-being of the farmers, and because he wants to be a role model for cacao farmers who are the NGOs' target audience.   

The cacao farm is doing well for Bartolo because production, only in its second year, is picking up quickly to his great excitement. Aside from cacao, he also plants timber to practice the principles of agroforestry promoted in his work. He also plants plantain and pineapple for home use.

Bartolo's favorite part of cacao farming is harvesting because unlike other stages of working with cacao, it’s not particularly hard. Harvesting involves picking the ripe pods on the trees and cracking them to extract the seeds inside. A cacao pod typically houses 35 seeds surrounded by a sweet juicy pulp that can be enjoyed as a fruit, but starts fermenting shortly after it is opened. Farmers have the option of either processing their own cacao or selling it wet for centralized fermentation and drying. The challenging part for Bartolo is field maintenance due to his busy work schedule. Oftentimes Bartolo checks on his farm early in the morning before heading out to work. 

Bartolo is requesting this loan to hire people from his village to clean his cacao farm so that he can focus fully on his job while also maintaining his agricultural activities. Cleaning is the process of removing the underbrush from the cacao farm as well as cleaning the surroundings to facilitate airflow in the field and make trees accessible for pruning or harvest.

loans.use: To clean and prune five acres of cacao farm

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor and his wife Teresa are raising four adopted children in the village of Santa Elena, on a road that connects southern Belize to southeastern Guatemala. The kids, ages eight to twelve, are all currently in school, and help out around the farm on free time. Teresa takes care of the family, helps out at the farm and makes local Maya crafts including woven baskets from the jippi jappa palm as well as hand bracelets. 

New to cacao farming, Victor was encouraged to enter in the trade by his father, who is a member in the local cooperative.  “I wanted to see what I can doo with it too,” he told Maya Mountain Cacao. Last year, Victor used savings from five years of gardening and landscaping work in the resort town of Placencia to purchase a cacao farm of three acres and around 850 trees. Seeing the benefit of cacao farming already, he is planning to expand the farm by transplanting 250 seedlings raised in bags in an on-farm nursery. “Cacao is money in the bank. When you’re harvesting, you feel happy you’re not wasting time with what you’re doing,” he said. 

The tricky parts of cacao farming for Victor and many of his peers are the woodpeckers and the squirrels. Cacao pods are defenseless against the assailants, who work their way through the thick pod to pick at the seeds one at a time. Farmers can save a “broken into” pod if they find it within a short period of its opening. However, with frequent rains, if any water reaches the seeds housed inside, they germinate and the crop can be deemed useless. “You could spend the whole day on the farm, come back another day at daybreak and they’d already gotten to your ripe pods,” says Victor, who is looking into buying a pellet gun, among other investments for his farm.

If all goes well in the cacao growing business, Victor is hoping to open his home and organic farm for tourists. Besides cacao, he grows corn, beans and ginger, and he plans to start planting coffee. Also, alongside his work on the farm, Victor is the Vice-Alcalde (mayor) for his village and works in the nearby Rio Blanco National Park. This loan will help Victor with his first expansion. Before planting, he will first need to prepare the land by chopping the underbrush and lining. Lining is the process of planning and marking the spots where seedlings will be planted to ensure a linear structure and sufficient spacing. The task at hand will require hiring three men to help Victor on the farm for six days.

loans.use: To clean and expand a cacao farm

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli offers homemade breads in her locality. She has been in line with this kind of business for four years now. According to her, she is able to earn about PHP 3,000 a month. Her earned income goes towards their daily necessities, school fees, daily allowances and monthly electric bill. Arceli used to sell her breads house to house and on a delivery basis.

Arceli is now 54 years of age and married with six children.Two of them are already married; one is an overseas Filipino workers (OFW), two are laborers and her youngest child is still studying. With the number of children she has, she and her spouse both work hard to increase their income. Arceli plans to buy yeast, eggs, flour and cooking oil but her capital intended for her food production sales is no longer enough, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000. She knows that this amount will help her to realize her goals in life and with her business.

loans.use: to buy yeast, eggs, flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Clarence

texts.en:
Clarence, age 43, is currently living in Punta Gorda town, where he owns and runs a small jewelry shop. He and his wife Monica have brought up four children, all of who are enrolled in school at the moment. Apart from his jewelry shop, he is also involved in cacao farming. He is managing eight acres of cacao that he planted five years ago and that are now beginning to produce pods. He got into cacao because he was looking for a crop to plant on his land, and was interested in the stable market and good prices for cacao.  

Clarence is really excited about cacao because his trees are producing for the first time and he is confident that as the years go by his production will increase. Besides cacao, he also plants various fruit trees on his farm. His wife Monica stays home to take care of the three kids and his oldest son goes out with him on the farm on the weekends.
 
According to Clarence, his favorite part of cacao farming is the harvesting process because all of the hard work is done at that point and it’s just a matter of walking and picking the ripe pods. The challenging part for him is the cleaning because it requires a significant amount of time and his jewelry shop keeps him busy.

Clarence is requesting the loan to hire people from Big Falls to clean his farm and also to plant 4,000 more cacao trees as an investment in his family's future. Cleaning is the process of removing the underbrush in the cacao farm to clear access for harvesting and pruning. Cacao grows in agroforestry systems on lush jungle soil that gets plenty of rain in the wet season and sun in the dry season, resulting in fast-paced growth. Farmers typically have to clean their cacao fields three times a year. Planting is the process of transplanting seedlings grown in bags for six months into the ground and requires precision in spacing among other things.

loans.use: To clean a cacao farm and plant new seedlings.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro and his wife Juana live in the village of Silver Creek in Belize’s southernmost district of Toledo. The couple has raised six children, aged eight to 35, two of who are still in school. Pedro says he hopes his children make the right choices without having to steer them. “I told them, 'Put your mind to work because farming is hard,'” he told Maya Mountain Cacao in his second language after Q'eqchi'. 

A cacao farmer for six years, Pedro currently manages three acres with about 1,000 cacao trees. Pedro likes cacao because it is a permanent crop that does not require replanting every year. “I like it and my wife likes it too,” says Pedro, adding that she’s been great help at harvest, especially after their oldest boys left to join the Belize Defense Force. His favorite part of cacao is seeing the trees clean. “I don’t like to have the suckers. I like to dress it up. Once it’s clean it bears plenty better,” says Pedro. Cacao farmers refer to suckers as trees that “suck” the fertile topsoil without bearing fruit. Cacao pods are fruits that grow directly on the trunk and house about 35 seeds, which can then go through various stages of processing to make chocolate. 

The family is requesting this loan to hire two men to help clean the three acres, a job that could take two weeks with the three of them working daily. Cleaning means cutting the underbrush that surrounds cacao trees and is especially instrumental in preparing land for planting new cacao seedlings. After a portion of Pedro’s farm burnt down a year ago, he’s decided to give it another try and is ready to transplant seedlings raised in a nursery on his farm. Seedlings are small cacao trees raised in a bag, typically for six months prior to transplanting into the ground. Cacao is ready for the ground when it has four or more leaves.

loans.use: To hire help to clean and plant over burnt cacao

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 32-year-old father of one child, aged seven years. He sells fruits and vegetables in Kangundo town. He mostly sells raw bananas, oranges, and mangoes. Vegetables include cabbages and spinach. He has been in this business for four years and it has been profitable since he has been able to provide for the needs of his family from the income he gets.

This will be Francis' third loan term and he plans to use the entire amount to buy more stocks of vegetables and fruits to sell. These include cabbages, spinach, and lettuce which are usually in high demand in the area. He also plans to buy bananas, mangoes, watermelon, paw paw, and oranges to sell. He anticipates generating more income which he will use to pay school fees for his child.

Francis hopes to expand his business by opening a big grocery store at the marketplace and, thereby, making more income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Shahribonu

texts.ru: Шахрибону проживает на районе Спитамен. Ей 61 год. Она вдова и имеет взрослого сына. Ее сын женат, но в данный момент находится в России на заработках.  Она занимается животноводством уже более 28 лет. В этой деятельности ей помогает невестка. Дополнительно Шахрибону работает в деканском хозяйстве, она имеет 2 га земли под рис. Сейчас Шахрибону хочет расширить свою животноводческую деятельность. С этой целью она запрашивает кредит для купли продажи крупно-рогатого скота.
texts.en: Shahribonu lives in the Spitamen Region. She is 61 years old. She is a widow and has a grown child. Her son is married but is currently in Russia as a migrant worker. Shahribonu has been raising livestock for over 28 years. Her daughter-in-law helps her in this. In addition, Shahribonu works for a cooperative farm; she has two hectares [about 5 acres] to grow rice. At present, Shahribonu wants to expand her livestock business. For this purpose, she is requesting a loan to buy cattle for later resale.

loans.use: to buy cattle for resale.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
This is Letecia, 59, resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Letecia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo,  PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP15,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Letecia hopes to make her variety store a grocery store. She dreams of visiting other places and taking a vacation.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Colleta

texts.en:
Colleta is a married woman, 35 years old. She is blessed with three children, aged 12, ten, and four years old. She operates a boutique shop where she sells cultural outfits, as well as ornaments. She has been running the business for ten years, earning a monthly income of KES 30,000.

She has borrowed a fourth loan of KES 60,000 from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) which she intends to use to purchase more cultural garments and fabrics for sale in her business. 


The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for her school-going children. Her dreams are to improve her living standards and to own her residential plot.

loans.use: to purchase cultural garments and fabrics for sale.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is married, with 4 children. Eliza is 44 years old and lives in Upper Centro Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Eliza sells furniture to earn a living and has had this business for 25 years. Each month, she earns PHP 25,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase materials for her furniture business.

Eliza has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for one year. In the future, Eliza hopes to save more for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her furniture business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es una mujer de 42 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, lastimosamente hace poco tiempo Victoria sufrió la pérdida de su amado esposo, desde entonces ella se ha dedicado por completo a sacar adelante a su familia, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene muchos deseos de superación; Victoria no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar deliciosos postres.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Victoria trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 6 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Victoria se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un tanque eternit para su vivienda, de esta manera podrá contar con un mejor sistema potable que le brinde mayor seguridad y bienestar para ella y su familia, así pues Victoria seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver convertido a su hijo en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Victoria is 42 years old and lives in the city of Ica with her son.  She loves her son and says he is her main reason for living.  Sadly, a little while ago she suffered the loss of her beloved husband, and since then she has dedicated all of her efforts to providing for her family.  Victoria is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person with a strong desire to get ahead.  Victoria was unable to study a professional career because she had to work to help her parents from a very early age.  In her free moments she likes to bake delicious desserts.

On her own initiative and with a lot of effort and determination, Victoria works her own small business selling food.  She works every day from early in the morning for approximately six hours. 
Victoria feels at ease when working her business, which she thinks does well because she is a good cook and treats her customers with kindness. 

Victoria is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their support, she will be able to buy a sanitary water storage tank for her home. In this way, Victoria will have a better drinking water system and will increase her family’s security and welfare.  She will also continue working and striving to achieve her greatest dream, which is to see her son become a distinguished professional.

loans.use: to buy a sanitary water storage tank.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel, a 30-year-old married mother of five children, four of whom are in school, has been farming vegetables in the Philippines for six years now. She has received five previous loans from NWTF to sustain her enterprise, and is now requesting a new one for PHP 15000 to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

In the future, Liezel would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is from Msambweni. She’s married and has children. She is a very hard-working, responsible, very honest woman. Her dream has always been to have an eatery, and to sell beverages in general, at home. Today she has her own business, and she has a regular clientele and good income thanks to her work and effort.

Saumu tells us that she wants to continue growing. This is why she always strives, and works from sun to sun, and why she’s asking for a loan to buy beverages, meat, condiments, vegetables, and other ingredients for her eatery. She is thankful for the support she’s getting from Kiva and Yehu Microfinance.

loans.use: to buy beverages, meat, condiments, vegetables and other ingredients for her eatery.

loans.name: Naema

texts.en:
Naema, 39, is married to Gewar, 35. In their marriage, Naema and Gewar have been blessed with two children, Yunita, 17, and Novita, 11, both attending school. Naema runs a kiosk business, working 7 to 10 hours everyday. Prior to having her kiosk, she sold her goods from her living room.

Naema desires to improve her business and so is requesting a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM to add more items such as sugar, tea, coffee, soap, instant noodles, snacks, mosquito coils, etc. She is confident that having a wider inventory will attract more customers, thereby increasing her profits.

loans.use: to buy more kiosk items such as sugar, tea, coffee, soap, instant noodles, snacks, mosquito coils, etc.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.ru:
Махмуд 36 - летний житель района Зафаробод, города Истаравшан. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он энергичный молодой человек. 
Махмуд вместе с семьей занимается растениеводством. Он выращивает овощи для продажи. У него имеется небольшой участок орошаемой земли. Махмуд берет кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений, чтобы получить хороший урожай.
texts.en:
Mahmud is a 36-year-old inhabitant of the Zafarobod region, in the town of Istaravshan. He is married and has three children. He is an energetic, young man. 

Mahmud and his family are engaged in raising crops. He grows vegetables for sale. He has a small plot of irrigated land. Mahmud is taking a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers, in order to get a good harvest.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers to get a good harvest

loans.name: Tasleem's Group

texts.en:
Tasleem is 43 years old, and a very hard-working and independent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her family. Her family includes two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a businessman. He has been running his own dairy shop and sports shop. Their eldest son is a taxi driver.

Tasleem is a clothing seller. She runs a small clothing sales business in her house. She purchases clothes from different areas of Peshawar and Lahore, and she resells them in Rawalpindi. By doing this she gets a good amount of profit, which helps her to meet the household expenses. Presently, she needs some additional capital to grow her business. Therefore, as a member of this five-person borrowing group, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount, she will purchase a variety of clothes from different areas, to resell in her own community. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. 

Note: In the picture Tasleem raises her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena, a 44-year-old married mother of three children, works very hard to provide for her family. Magdalena has been operating a general store in the Philippines for six years now, selling a variety of items such as shampoo, canned goods, detergent and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Magdalena would like to save enough money so she can continue to support her children's college education.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Erika Soledad

texts.es:
Erika tiene 61 años, vive al lado de su esposo, quien es su mano derecha y es su mayor apoyo en todo lo que ella hace y juntos tienen 2 hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad y son su mayor motivación para seguir esforzándose a pesar de las adversidades que tienen la vida. Su vivienda se ubica en la linda ciudad de Ocoña, Ocoña es una ciudad en la cual se desarrolla mucho la agricultura en especial el cultivo de arroz, frejoles, maíz, entre otros, también se desarrolla mucho la pesca. Cuando dispone de un tiempito libre le gusta mucho pasear ir a la playa a pasear ya que  le encanta distraerse, asimismo le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Seco de Pollo”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos él solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado mucho tener una carrera universitaria.

Día a Día Erika trabaja con mucho esfuerzo y entusiasmo como agricultora, ella tiene una pequeña parcela en la cual ha sembrado arroz, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día ya que su parcela queda un poco alejada de su vivienda y sobre todo porque siempre tiene que estar al pendiente del crecimiento de su cultivo; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y cuidadoso y sobre todo porque le gusta su labor.

Erika está muy agradecida y feliz con la ayuda que le han brindado los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono y fertilizantes para evitar que su cultivo se llene de plagas y de esta manera poder obtener un mejor crecimiento y una mejor cosecha, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando y luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” mejorar su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Erika is 61 years old and lives with her husband, who is her right-hand man and her greatest support in everything she does. They have two children together, ages 3 and 8, who are their greatest motivation to continue working hard despite their adversities in life. Their home is located in the lovely city of Ocoña. Agriculture is a particularly important industry in Ocoña, especially the cultivation of rice, beans, and corn, among others. Fishing is also an important industry.

When she has some free time, Erika likes to take walks along the beach, because she loves to distract herself. She also likes to eat one of her favorite dishes, the delicious "Seco de Pollo" (chicken stew). Due to her limited financial resources, she was only able to study until the fifth grade of secondary school, but she would have very much liked to have a university degree.

Day to day, Erika works with plenty of effort and enthusiasm as a farmer. She has a small plot of land where she has planted rice. She works for about 10 hours per day in her business because her plot is located a bit far away from her home, and above all because she always has to pay close attention to her crops. She believes that her work is going well because she is very responsible and thorough, and above all because she likes her work.

Erika is very grateful and happy for the help which the Kiva lenders are offering her, because thanks to their help she will able to buy manure and fertilizer to avoid infestations in her crops and obtain better growth and a better harvest. This will allow her to continue working and fighting to make her greatest dream come true: "to improve her home".

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana de 61 años es soltera y tiene 2 hijos a quienes logro sacar adelante y hacerlos personas de bien , actualmente Susana vive en su casa propia  en compañia de su nieta Alexandra de 13 años a quien cría y desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida.Susana se dedica a la venta de frutas y productos regionales y trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano en el puesto de ventas que tiene en su vivienda por esta razon ofrece a su público las frutas mas frescas y saludables . Lleva en este negocio más de 3 años y le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que termina su trabajo al mediodía y esto le permite descansar por las tardes y dedicarse a las actividades propias del hogar. En su trabajo le va muy bien ya que genera buenos ingresos económicos pero a su vez necesita ampliar su negocio razon por la cual solicitará S/. 800 soles para la compra de frutas de la region al por mayor tales como  cocona, naranjas , papaya , platanos , entre otros .A su vez se se muestra agradecida con MFP por la confianza brindada y se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Susana is 61 years old and single with two children. She has managed to provide for her children and make them into good people. She currently lives in her own home along with her 13-year-old granddaughter, Alexandra, whom she cares for and to whom she hopes to offer a better quality of life.

Susana makes a living selling fruit and regional products. She works every day from the early morning, making sales from the stand she has in her home. She offers her clients the freshest and healthiest fruit. She has been in this business for more than 3 years, and she likes it very much because she finishes working at midday, which allows her to rest in the afternoon and dedicate herself to housework. 

Her work is going very well because it gives her a good income, but at the same time she needs to expand her business. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of 800 Peruvian soles to buy wholesale fruit from her region, such as coconas, oranges, papayas, and bananas, among others. She is grateful to MFP for their confidence in her, and she is committed to paying her fees on time.

loans.use: to buy regional fruit.

loans.name: Ehrom

texts.ru:
Эхром житель города Истаравшан. Ему 33 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей, 2 сыновей и 2 девочек. Образование у Эхрома среднее.
Эхром занимается торговлей на центральном рынке своего города. Вот уже 10 лет как он работает в этой области. На протяжении этих лет он смог открыть собственный магазин. Сейчас у него магазин мужской одежды. 
Эхром берет кредит для приобретение сезонного товара. За счет полученной прибыли он хочет увеличить ассортимент товара и улучшить финансовое положение.
texts.en:
Ehrom is an inhabitant of the town of Istaravshan. He is 33 years old, married, and has four children, two sons and two daughters. Ehrom has a high school education.

Ehrom is engaged in trade in the central market of his town. He has been working in this area for ten years already. During those years, he was able to open his own shop. Now, he has a men's clothing store. 

Ehrom is taking a loan for the purchase of seasonal goods. He wants to use the profits to increase the range of his products and to improve his financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase spring menswear to increase his range of products and improve his financial position

loans.name: Abdumavlon

texts.ru:
Абдумавлон житель города Истаравшан. Ему 34 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Абдумавлон честный и ответственный человек. Он вместе с семьей занимается разведением крупно-рогатого скота. Кроме того при доме у Абдумавлона имеется участок земли, где он вместе семьей занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур. 
Абдумавлон запрашивает кредит для зукупа коров и телят. Он хочет расширить свою деятельность и увеличить поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Abdumavlon is an inhabitant of the town of Istaravshan. He is 34 years old, married, and has three children. Abdumavlon is an honest and responsible person. He and his family are involved in raising cattle. In addition, Abdumavlon has by his home a plot of land where he and his family plant crops.  

Abdumavlon is requesting a loan to buy cows and calves. He wants to expand his activities and increase the number of his livestock.

loans.use: to buy calves and cows in order to expand his operations and increase the number of his livestock

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is a hard-working entrepreneur, who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase goods to sell at her general store, like shampoo, bread, snack foods, oil and other groceries. Ofelia has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from farming sugarcane.

Ofelia successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting a new loan, to further build her general store business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell in her general store, like shampoo, bread, snack foods and other groceries

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es:
Sarita  tiene 26 años, es madre soltera y con mucho esfuerzo saca adelante a su pequeño de 2 años de edad el cual es su mayor motivación para seguir esforzándose a pesar de las adversidades que tienen la vida. Su vivienda se ubica en la linda ciudad de Aguaytia, ciudad en la cual se desarrolla mucho la agricultura en especial el cultivo de cacao, yuca, plátano, entre otros, y posee atractivos turísticos muy bellos. Cuando dispone de un tiempito libre le gusta mucho escuchar música y sobre todo porque su pequeño baila al son de la música y eso la alegra mucho, asimismo le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Tallarín Saltado”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo pudo estudiar el  nivel primario, pero le hubiera gustado mucho tener una carrera universitaria.

Día a Día Sarita trabaja con mucho esfuerzo y entusiasmo como agricultora, ella tiene una pequeña parcela en la cual ha sembrado cafe, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día ya que tiene que estar al pendiente del crecimiento de su cultivo y cuidar de que no ingresen plagas a los frutos de las plantas; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y cuidadoso y sobre todo porque le gusta su labor.

Sarita está muy agradecida y feliz con la ayuda que le han brindado los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono y fertilizantes para evitar que su cultivo se llene de plagas y de esta manera poder obtener un mejor crecimiento y una mejor cosecha, así podrá mejorar sus ingresos y permitirle seguir trabajando y luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Construir su casa de material noble y brindarle a su hijo una profesión”.
texts.en:
Sarita is 26 years old. She is a single mother who puts in plenty of effort to provide for her two-year-old son, who is her greatest motivation to keep working hard despite the adversities in her life. Her home is located in the lovely city of Aguaytia. Agriculture is a particularly important industry in Aguaytia, especially the cultivation of cocoa, cassava, and bananas, among others. It also has some beautiful tourist attractions.

When she has some free time, Sarita likes to listen to music, especially because her little son dances to the sound of the music and that makes her very happy. She also likes to eat one of her favorite dishes, the delicious "Tallarín Saltado" (fried rice with wonton). Due to her limited financial resources, she was only able to study to the primary school level, but she would have liked very much to have a university degree.

Day to day, Sarita works with plenty of effort and enthusiasm as a farmer. She has a small plot of land where she has planted coffee. She works for about 10 hours a day in her business, because she has to pay very close attention to the growth of her crops and make sure that no infestation affects the fruits of her plants. She believes that her work is going well because she is very responsible and thorough, and above all because she likes her work.

Sarita is very grateful and happy with the help that the Kiva lenders are giving her, because thanks to their help she will be able to buy manure and fertilizer to avoid infestations in her crops. In this way, she will be able to obtain better crop growth and a better harvest. She will then be able to improve her income and continue working and fighting to make her greatest dream come true: "To build her house with good-quality materials and to provide her son with a profession."

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
This is Alma. She previously obtained a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy fish and vegetables for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children, and in the family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy fish, pork, chicken and vegetables to resell in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to provide for the family's daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Alma hopes to expand her business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the group and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fish, pork, chicken and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Qizilboy

texts.ru:
Кизилбой житель города Дангара. Ему 60 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей, три сына и две дочки. Его старший сын работает за рубежом, а второй помогает в хозяйстве, третий учится в школе. Старшая дочь Кизилбоя замужем, а вторая домохозяйка. Кизилбой очень деятельный человек. Он занимается земледелием. Также еще дополнительно он работает учителем в средней школе. 
Кизилбой берет кредит для переработки земли и покупки семян овощей. Он хочет посеять и получить богатый урожай.
texts.en:
Qilziboy is a resident of the town of Dangara. He is 60 years old, married and has five children: three sons and two daughters. His older son works abroad and his second son helps with the business and his third is going to school. Qilziboy's oldest daughter is married and his second one is a housewife. Qilziboy is an entrepreneurial man. He is in agriculture. He also works as a teacher in the secondary school additionally.

Qilziboy is taking out the loan to cultivate the land and buy vegetable seeds. He wants to sow and collect a rich harvest.

loans.use: to cultivated the land and purchase seeds of vegetables to sow and collect a rich harvest for sale.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia de 40 años, esta casada con James con quien tiene seis hijos, ellos viven juntos en una casa propia y desde ahí educan diariamente a sus hijos. El trabajo de Celia consiste en la confección de prendas de vestir, razón por la cual tiene un pequeño taller su hogar en donde realiza todos los trabajos que le encargan sus habituales clientes. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 11 años y con el paso del tiempo a ido aprendiendo a dar un servicio de calidad a sus clientes.Le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues le permite mantenerse distraída, además de que puede disponer de su tiempo y asi manejar sus horarios cómodamente, sin embargo le fue complicado adaptarse a la independencia  ya que siempre trabajó para otras personas y no sabía como sobrellevar su propio negocio pero con el tiempo fue perdiendo la inseguridad y ahora es una gran trabajadora en este rubro .En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles para comprar materiales de confecciòn tales como telas , agujas , elasticos , cierres entre otros por lo tanto esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá el apoyo financiero necesario para continuar con su negocio y asu vez esta comprometida a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en: Celia is 40, she is married to James with whom she has six children, they live together at a house they own and they educate their children from home.  Celia's work consists of dress making, she has a small shop at her home where she provides all the services that her customers request.  She has done this work for 11 years and as time goes by she has learned to provide good quality service to her customers.  She really enjoys her work, it keeps her mind occupied, she can also manage her own time and make schedules at her convenience, it wasn't easy to get used to being independent because she had always worked for other people and didn't know how to manage her own business, with time her insecurities faded and now she is great at her activity. At this time she is requesting 1,500 new soles to buy dress making materials such as fabric, needles, elastics, zippers and other items, she is very happy to know that she will have the financial support needed to continue with her business and is committed to make her loan payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy dress making materials such as fabric, needles, elastics, zippers and other items.

loans.name: Fredeswinda

texts.en:
Fredeswinda is a 44-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has seven children. The eldest is 27 and the youngest is 11 years old. She has been engaged in food vending for four years now. This is the source of her income. Her husband is a carpenter. 

Fredeswinda is requesting a loan to buy ingredients like oil, flour, sugar, glutinous rice, and coconut. These are the ingredients she uses in food vending. Through this loan, she will be able to buy these ingredients, and she can make food for her vending business and sell to her community.

In the future, Fredeswinda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like oil, flour, sugar, glutinous rice, and coconut.

loans.name: Buenas

texts.en:
Buenas is 53 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Buenas runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, soap, sugar, milk, etc.  She has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Buenas would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, soap, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 58 years old, married and has five children. She is a dairy farmer and has been doing this for the past ten years. She is a very hard working lady. She used her previous loan to buy animal feed. Her business did well and she repaid her loan. She describes her business environment as being very conducive. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has been able to buy a dairy cow.
Someday she hopes to own a large scale farm. She requires a loan of 20,857 KES to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Salvacion works hard to support her family.
She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling rice. Salvacion is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase goods to sell like shampoo, oil, sugar, bread, etc. in her general store.
Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities with her past 31 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell like shampoo, oil, sugar, bread, etc. in her general store.

loans.name: Salud

texts.en:
Salud is married with 4 children. Salud is 69 years old and lives in Lobogon , Aloran Misamis Occidental, Philippines.
Salud is a dealer of cosmetics like Avon, Natasha and Personal Collection to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more stock of cosmetic items from AVON, Natasha, and Personal Collection.
Salud has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Salud hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of cosmetic items from  AVON, Natasha, and Personal Collection.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more coconuts. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. She continues to work hard together with her husband to provide income for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy more quantities of coconuts for her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Teresita hopes that her business will stay longer and dreams of having a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partner /clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans

loans.use: to pay for more stock of coconuts needed for her business.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is from Msambweni. She works selling agricultural products and other types of products. She is married with children, all of them attend school. Her husband works at a dairy farm that provides milk to the neighborhood.

She is a hardworking entrepreneur who wants to be able to continue working and helping her family. She wants to continue growing her business and in this way continue helping her family.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy agricultural products, with which she will be able to supply her business and continue giving her customers the variety to which they are accustomed.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products.

loans.name: Rughaiyah

texts.en: Rughaiyah, 53, is living with her husband Ibrahim who is 61 years old and their two children: Djamal, 19, who is graduated from senior high school and Jumaidin, 10, who is attending the fifth grade. Rughaiyah has been running a kiosk for 2 years. The income earned from this business enables her to help her husband in covering their living expenses. Currently, Rughaiyah wants to improve her business by increasing the stock at her kiosk. By selling more items she can generate more income. Therefore, Rughaiyah requested a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. She will spend the loan on sugar, coffee, shampoo, bath soap, detergent, instant noodles, etc.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, shampoo, bath soap, detergent, instant noodles, etc. for her kiosk.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
This is Merlita. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more products for her variety store. She also owns and oversees a tricycle for additional income. She and her husband who is a cook work hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Merlita hopes to see her business growing larger and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah's group is comprised of 3 hard working women. Sarah is 24 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past 4 years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her boutique, which trades in adult and children’s wear.

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 800000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more clothes for sale, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and take care of her necessities. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business.
