texts.en: Celestine has been selling fried fish for the past 3 years now, in her community Soba Hohoe. Celestine received education through a junior high school level. She is married and has 6 children with her husband who is a farmer in their community. Celestine helps her husband care for their children. Her loan will be used to buy large cartons of fresh fish. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a refrigerator to be able to store and buy fish in larger quantities and sell in the neighboring communities.

loans.use: to buy large cartons of fresh fish.

loans.name: Mesaidi

texts.en:
Mesaidi is married and has two children. Previously she was a mobile vendor of food stuff. With great effort she was able to open her own shop, which currently has numerous customers in the area.

Mesaidi attends her shop while her husband dedicates himself to his business. Both are making great efforts to get ahead and to help their children, since they want them to finish their studies and become successful people.

She is requesting the loan to buy meat, vegetables, bulk foods and other basic products. She is grateful for this opportunity which she is receiving, since it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, bulk foods and other basic products.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married and has 3 children. She has never attended school. Margaret sells ladies sandals in Soba, Hohoe, which she has done since 2007. Margaret recently decided to sells bowls in addition to her sandals to get extra income to support her husband who is a farmer. Margaret uses her income to assist her husband pay for their children school fees and the general family upkeep. Margaret will use the loan to purchase more bowls and also introduce the sale of children’s sandal so that she makes an even larger profit. With the new profits from her expanded business, Margaret plans to save for her old age.

loans.use: to purchase more bowls and also introduce the sale of children’s sandals.

loans.name: Mwarabu

texts.en:
Mwarabu lives in Likoni, Mombasa. She is single and has six children for who she strives tirelessly to provide a life of dignity that’s free from want. She owns a well-stocked grocery store in Likoni where she’s worked with her family for more than 10 years.

Mwarabu is asking for the loan to buy bulk grains, soft-drinks, meat, dairy products, vegetables and other supplies to keep the store well-stocked. She is grateful for the opportunity she’s getting because thanks to it she will be able to stay in business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains, soft-drinks, meat, dairy products, vegetables and other supplies.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en: Mwanajuma is a merchant who makes a living buying and selling fish. She has been dedicated to this activity for more than two years, so she already has some good experience. She is known as a person with a strong desire to move up in life and help her family. She is requesting the loan to purchase fish, which she will use to have more fish in stock since demand is high and she wants to be able to satisfy her customers. Mwanajuma is grateful for the help she is receiving from Kiva partner Yehu Microfinance because it will be a big help.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Aunty Mercy Group

texts.en:
This group consists of 4 members, Mercy, Janet, Jonse and Sarah. They sell provisions, plantain, palm oil, and cosmetics respectively.

Mercy is a 63 years old provision seller (Milk, Milo, sugar, rice, biscuits, canned tomatoes and other canned products). She is married to Emmanuel who is 66 years old. She has been doing this business for 6 years now. She buys from a market in the capital and sells in the Dansoman community.

This is her 3rd loan with ID Ghana and she needs a loan of GHS 700 to buy more goods to sell to her customers.
The entire group needs an amount of GHS 2,550 to buy more goods to sell to their respective customers.

loans.use: to buy more provisions like milk, Milo, sugar, rice, biscuits, canned tomatoes and other canned products to sell to customers.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is widowed with three children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has a business of selling popcorn. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more maize for making popcorn. She generates additional income through selling charcoal and chicken. She works at the market and has been in this business for five years and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenge includes seasonality and transportation. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also to open up another branch selling popcorn. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more maize for making popcorn.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en: Jovita is 38 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Jovita used her last loan to buy new items to expand her inventory. Now she is requesting another loan in the amount of PHP 40,000. This is her 12th loan taken from GDMPC, and will be used to purchase a refrigerator for her soft-drinks and ice candy making. Her business runs well and has a healthy earning in which she is able to save portion. She hopes that her business will flourish more and more.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for her business.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru:
Фотима обратилась в организацию Арванд для получения кредита.  Она добрая и ответственная  женщина в возрасте 42 лет.  Замужем, имеет троих детей.  У Фотимы и ее мужа нету высшего образования поэтому   они всей семьей занимаются откормом скота. У них в наличии имеется 10 голов крупно  рогатого  скота.   Это их единственный доход в семье и очень приемлемый. Этим видом деятельности Фотима научилась от своих родителей.   Каждую неделю ее муж выводит откормленных скотов на рынок и продает и сразу же покупает молодых телят. Фотима старается  развивать этот бизнес. Она очень долгое время мечтала отремонтировать свой дом так как они живут в очень плохих условиях. Надеется  накопить денег и этим летом создать хорошие условия проживания  для своих детей.  
На полученный кредит Фотима планирует купить несколько  голов  скота, так как сейчас скот  можно купить за дешевую цену. Она заранее благодарит организацию Арванд за финансовую поддержку и понимание.
texts.en: Fotima is a kind and responsible woman who has turned to Arvand for a loan.  She is 42 years old and is married with three children.  Neither Fotima nor her husband have a higher education, which is why they and their whole family raise livestock.  They have ten head of cattle that comprise their only income, which is acceptable.  Fotima learned about this line of work from her parents.  Every week her husband takes the fattened cows to the market to sell and he immediately purchases young calves.  Fotima is trying to increase their business.  For a long time, she has dreamed of making repairs to their home, as they live in very poor conditions.  She hopes to save up the money and maybe this summer she can improve their living situation for her children.  On receiving her loan, Fotima plans to buy a few head of livestock, as they are available at a lower price right now.  She thanks Arvand in advance for their financial support and understanding.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Ziriya

texts.en:
Ziriya is married with four children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling sweet potatoes and has been in this business for 6 months. 

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sweet potatoes. She generates additional income through selling tomatoes and Royco (packaged food mixes). She works at the market six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  

Ziriya is hoping to buy land in the future so as to start growing sweet potatoes and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house where the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a food vendor at Soba, Hohoe. Monica has received schooling through a middle school level.  She is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a farmer. Monica has been cooking and selling food for the past 21 years but decided to take the loan to sell agrochemicals to support herself and her family. She assists her husband with the general housekeeping. Her loan will be used to buy a variety of agrochemicals to sell to the local farmers in her community. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to have enough funds to take care of her family now and in the future.

loans.use: to buy a variety of agrochemicals to sell to the local farmers in her community.

loans.name: Kamoliddin

texts.ru: Камолиддин , мужчина 31  года . Проживает в сельской местности.  Он  женат но  детей пока нет имеет.  Камолиддин с женой живут с его  родителями. Его родители являются пенсионерами.  Камолиддин единственный кормилец в семье. Он не смог учиться в свое время, так как в его семье  с детства были финансовые проблемы. Сейчас Камолиддин зарабатывает на жизнь водителем такси. Он перевозит пассажиров на личном авто с села в город. Его авто сейчас нуждается в ремонте и он хочет улучшить условия автомашины. Для того,  чтобы купить автозапчасти ему не хватает денежных средств поэтому   он обратился в организацию Арванд за кредитом. Камолиддин очень надеется что организация Арванд ему поможет  и поддержит в финансовом вопросе и заранее благодарит.
texts.en: Kamoliddin is a 31-year-old man who lives in a small village.  He is married but he does not yet have any children.  He and his wife live with his parents, who are pensioners.  Kamoliddin is the only breadwinner in the family.  He was not able to study in his time, as his family had faced financial problems since he was a child.  Now Kamoliddin works as a taxi driver.  He shuttles passengers from the village to the city in his own car.  His car needs repairs and he wants to improve his car's conditions.  He needs money to buy these auto parts, so he has turned to Arvand for a loan.  Kamoliddin hopes that Arvand will help and support him in his financial situation.  He gives his thanks in advance.

loans.use: to buy auto parts

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is from Aurora in the province of Zamboanga del Sur. She is 52 years old. She is married and the mother of nine adult-aged children. Her husband is a farmer. Her husband helps her as well with her gardening. Julieta is in an agriculture business, planting and harvesting vegetables for sale. She has been in this business for about 7 years. 

Gardening is the main source of income for the family. Operating this type of business helps the family and it has a good return. Julieta sells her harvest to the public market and she earns about 3,300 PHP per month. Luckily, she was able to meet her obligations.

Julieta is requesting a loan in the amount of 6,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for her garden. This is the fourth cycle loan taken by Julieta from GDMPC. In the future she plans to save a portion of her income so she can do some renovation in her little house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for her garden.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy prepares kenkey, a local Ghanaian dish, for sale in Soba, Hohoe. Kenkey is a traditional Ghanaian meal that is made with corn flour. It requires fermentation in order to create its unique flavor and is usually served with a soup, stew, or sauce. It is produced by cooking fermented dough of corn/maize wrapped in maize husks and steamed. Kenkey can be eaten with various kinds of sauces, such as pepper sauce. It is often served with meat or fish, such as fried or roasted fish, roasted chicken or roasted turkey. 

Lucy has never been to school due to financial difficulties in her family growing up.  She is married and has 5 children with her husband, who is a farmer. Lucy has been selling kenkey for the past 8 years now. She is responsible for the basic needs of the home. Her loan will be used to buy a bag of maize so she can cook and sell her kenkey recipe in large quantities. She hopes to use the new profits for her children’s upkeep and education.

loans.use: to buy a bag of maize so she can cook and sell her kenkey recipe in large quantities.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Bertha is married and has 7 children with her husband, who is a peasant farmer in Soba, Hohoe. She has received schooling only through a primary school level. Bertha prepares and sells kenkey at Soba, Hohoe, which she has done for the past 4 years now. 

Kenkey is a traditional Ghanaian meal which is produced by cooking fermented corn dough wrapped in maize husks and steamed. Kenkey can be eaten hot or cold with various kinds of sauces, such as the common pepper sauce. It is also often served either with meat or fish, such as fried or roasted fish, roasted chicken or roasted turkey. 

Bertha uses her income to help her husband feed the family, and she also buys books for her children's education. She will use the loan to purchase a large bag of maize and a greater quantity of fish to enable her to expand her food business. She plans to save her new profits and reinvest them into the business.

loans.use: to purchase a large bag of maize and a greater quantity of fish, to enable her to expand her food business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is married and has 2 children. She has received schooling up to junior high school. Veronica sells provisions at Soba, Hohoe, which she has done for the past three years now. Her husband is a kente weaver (Kente is a traditional, brightly colored Ghanaian textile). 

Veronica uses her income for the general upkeep of herself and her family. She will use the loan to introduce the sale of bananas and other items into her provision business. Veronica plans to save the new profits from her expanded business and expand her shop.

loans.use: to introduce the sale of bananas and other items into her provision business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is single and has two children. She has received schooling from nursery school to junior high school.  She is a petty trader in Soba Township, Hohoe. Agnes has been trading for about 3 years now. She has two children, so she uses her income to pay their school fees and for all their financial needs, and she is also responsible for her own general upkeep. 

She will use her loan to purchase various items to sell. She hopes to expand her business through her increased and diverse inventory. Agnes plans to save the new profits from her expanded business for the future of her business.

loans.use: to purchase various items to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman with 4 children. She has received schooling from primary school to junior high school, but couldn’t continue because her parents didn’t see a reason to further their daughter’s education. Her husband is a farmer. 

Evelyn cooks and sells Waakye, a local Ghanaian dish. Waakye is a very popular Ghanaian food. It can be eaten as breakfast, lunch or supper, and is served with macaroni, wele (cow skin), gari, salad with pepper sauce, tomato sauce, fish or meat. 

To prepare her Waakye, Evelyn gets beans, rice and colored leaves from the market. She cooks the beans until they become tender and adds the colored leaves to give them a reddish color. Then she adds the rice to the bean mixture. She cooks the rice and beans until they become tender enough to eat. 

She uses her income to assist her spouse in paying her children's school fees. Evelyn intended to use the loan to purchase cassava and sell it in her locality to enable her to make profits and increase her working capital for the expansion of her Waakye business.

loans.use: to purchase cassava and sell it in her locality.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is from Tiribe Mombasa, and operates a small hair salon. She wants to remodel her salon in order to offer her clients a more comfortable environment, and generate more income to help support her family. She is requesting this loan in order to help grow her business.

She is a very hardworking person with a persistent spirit and attitude. She has much experience in her field, and knows what she is doing. Her goal is to one day have a large beauty salon, and to be widely known for her talent. She is grateful for this opportunity, and believes that the support will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to remodel her beauty salon.

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is married and the father of four adult-aged children. He is 60 years old. He is separated from his wife. He was alone raising his children. Apparently, the children are in college now. 

Leo is in an agriculture business, planting and harvesting vegetables for sale. He plants vegetables like ampalaya, squash, root crops and others, and during the harvesting period he sells the vegetables to his contract buyer in the market. Leo has been in this business for about two years and earns about 4,200 PHP each month. He is also still engaged in manufacturing lampakanay (rope made of sea grass). 

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to purchase seedlings and fertilizer. Fertilizer here is very important for the good nourishment of the vegetable planted. This is the fourth loan taken by Leo from GDMPC. He is planning to buy a motorcycle for the fast delivery of his product.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the good nourishment of his vegetables.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en: Ayman is a 27-year-old single young man. He is a construction worker and gets a low salary which is not enough to cover his daily costs. He is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of finishing his house, such as paint and to decorate his home. This will improve his house and enable him to live in better home conditions. Ayman is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: pay the costs of finishing his house.

loans.name: Leonides

texts.en:
Leonides is 62 years old and lives in Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and a mother of four adult-aged children. Her husband is a wilder and has a little shop. 

Leonides is in a service-based business, she is a tailor. To earn a living she accepts orders like school uniforms, uniform for teachers, office uniforms, sports uniforms and others. She has been in this business for many years, about 35 years in service, and she earns about 7, 530 PHP a month. She is very happy doing this type of business. This is the main source of income for the family. Indeed, the income generated helps a lot for the education of her children. In fact, her oldest child earned a college degree and she is very proud of this. 

Leonides, went to the office to request a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase thread and cloth. This is the first cycle of loan taken by Leonides from GDMPC. Leonides plans in the future to buy another sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase thread and cloth.

loans.name: Nkwambia

texts.en:
Nkwambia lives in Tiribe, Kenya. She tells us she works in a beauty salon that she has in her own house. She has done this work for two years, which has helped her develop a good clientele that always goes to her.

She was getting experience in Mombasa. After some time there, she came to open her place here and she began to work. She is a very hardworking and enterprising person with a great desire to get ahead to help her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy supplies for her beauty salon such as dyes, creams, curlers, and other supplies necessary to stock her business and continue giving her customers good service.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon such as dyes, creams, curlers, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more wax-prints to sell to customers.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is from the village of Santa Cruz, Kapatagan, lanao del Norte. She is 45 years old and married. To make a living, Luisa owns and operates a "sari-sari" (general store) business in her local community, selling a variety of products. 

The last loan allowed her to purchase supplementary goods to sell. Her business runs smoothly, and now she is requesting a loan in the amount of 8,000 pesos to purchased additional products to sell like sugar, shampoo, eggs, noodles and other basic needs in her local community. Doing this type of business gives her a monthly return of about 3,000 pesos.

Luisa successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC. In the future, Luisa plans to reinvest her profit to her business. She wants to expand her business into a convenience store.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her store such as sugar, shampoo, eggs, and noodles.

location.town: Santa Cruz, kapatagan, lanao del Norte

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is from Tiribe. She is single and has five children, all of whom attend school and are dependent on her. Asha's business is buying and selling vegetables. She makes her sales to neighboring community and in the town market. She tells us that she has an established customer base, which helps her to make a very good income and thereby help her family.

Asha is requesting a loan to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, peppers, and onions. She tells us that this will enable her to stock up and have a larger variety of products to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell such as tomatoes, peppers, onions.

loans.name: Laban

texts.en:
Laban is a 44-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 2 years to 16 years. He describes himself to be a God-fearing, optimistic and focused man. He operates a retail business where he sells khat. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located at a viable business area and his primary customers are local residents. 

Laban describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy khat to sell. His business goal is to increase operating capital to Kes 100,000 within 5 years. In addition, Laban provides transportation service which adds to his business income. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy khat to sell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 36 years of age. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and a mother of four children. Her husband is a farmer. Marrissa decided to engage in the pig raising business to help her husband earn an income. Her husband's income is not enough for the needs of her children and for daily necessities.

Marissa is raising pigs for sale. She has been in this business for about four years. Each month Marrissa has a return in the amount of 2,300 pesos. She is very glad to be doing this type of business.

She went to GDMPS and requested a loan in the amount of 5,000 pesos to purchase feed for the pigs'  good nourishment. Marissa plans that in the future she could renovate her house to make it more comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs' good nourishment

loans.name: Mwanzagu

texts.en:
Mwanzagu is a merchant who makes a living buying and selling fish. He has been dedicated to this activity for more than one year, so he already has some good experience. Mwanzangu also has his own boat, nets and fishing equipment, which helps him work without depending on anyone. He is known as a person with a strong desire to move up in life and help his family. 

He is requesting the loan to purchase fish, which he will use to have more fish in stock since demand is high, and he wants to be able to satisfy his customers. Mwanzagu is grateful for the help he is receiving from Kiva partner Yehu Microfinance because it will be a big help.

loans.use: to purchase fish to satisfy his customers.

loans.name: Moses' Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are secondary school teachers in the town of Waterloo, near Sierra Leone’s capital city of Freetown. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in the northern city of Makeni, to request a loan of 19,100,000 Leones for the entire group. With the help of this loan, each of these teachers will be able to meet his immediate and most pressing needs. And at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Moses is the featured leader of this group of teachers. He is a native of Gbendembu village, in northern Sierra Leone. The 53-year-old is married to a teacher, and the couple has four children. Moses has served in the teaching profession for 28 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy building materials to refurbish his family’s dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy building materials to refurbish his family’s dwelling house.

loans.name: Rosa Elia

texts.es:
La señora  Rosa tiene 53 años , tiene  8 hijos es madre soltera, reside junto a uno de sus hijos menores en una comunidad del   Municipio de Tela, departamento de Atlántida.
Inicio su negocio hace 8 años, ella se dedica a la venta de alimentos de la canasta básica familiar a través de una pulpería.
Debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos que le permitan mejorar su situación económica Doña Rosa decidió establecer su negocio con el cual se  ha ayudado todo este tiempo.
Ella ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 10 ,000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de Arroz, frijoles, manteca, azúcar, maseca, harina, pan, medicinas de uso común y productos de higiene y limpieza.
Doña Rosa se siente muy animada a continuar invirtiendo en su negocio para aumentar sus ventas e ingresos que le permitan mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 53, is a single mother, and she has eight children.  She lives with her minor children in a community in the Tela municipality in the Atlántida department.

She started her business eight years ago.  She sells basic staple items in a grocery store.  Rosa decided to establish her business because of the need to generate income that would allow her to improve her financial situation.  This business has helped her during all of this time.

She has requested a loan for 10,000 lempiras, which she plans to use to buy rice, beans, shortening, sugar, Maseca [brand of corn flour], flour, bread, common use medicines, and cleaning and hygiene products.

Rosa is very excited to continue investing in her business.  She will do this to increase her sales and her income, which will allow her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, shortening, sugar, Maseca [brand of corn flour], flour, bread, common use medicines, and cleaning and hygiene products.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry lives in the Nkubu area of Kenya, which grows a lot of 'miraa', which can be chewed like tobacco. He has one child and has been doing this work for five years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and transportation services.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'harvesting after hard  work!' His biggest challenge is 'Poor weather conditions.' One of the animals in the farm is named 'Kairu.'

Henry was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Juhudi has the best products.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Micro-finance helps fight poverty.'

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Henry replied 'Improved feeding habits.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Henry owns the following: 'cow, poultry, pump, bicycle' but does not own 'pig, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, running water, TV, DVD' but does not have 'solar power, sewing machine'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To construct a zero-grazing unit

loans.name: Sendinda

texts.en:
Sendinda is a married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 8 years to 17 years. She describes herself to be God-fearing and an honest woman. She operates a retail store where she sells items such as sugar, salt, tea leaves, sodas, cereals, etc. Her business is located at a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. 

Sendinda describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy household-use items to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business and create job opportunities for people within five years. In addition, Sendinda sells 'khat' which increases her business income.

loans.use: to buy household-use items to sell

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity lives in the Nkubu area of Kenya, which hosts a campus at Mt. Kenya University. She has one child. She has been doing agricultural work for four years. Her primary income sources are derived from selling eggs, harvesting crops and providing transportation services.

Purity says that what is most enjoyable about farming are the profits achieved. Her biggest challenge is insecurity, she says. 

Purity was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Juhudi officers share freely with their clients."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, to which she replied, "Micro-financed loans are insured."

Her highest monthly expenses are the family's expenses. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Purity replied, "It will help me provide an advanced education for my child."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Purity owns poultry, a pump and a bicycle but does not own a cow, pig, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in her household a mosquito net, solar power, running water and TV but does not have electricity nor a sewing machine or a DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in the Nkubu area of Kenya, which hosts a campus at Mt. Kenya University. She has one child and has been doing agricultural work for five years.  Her primary income sources are derived from selling eggs, harvesting crops and attending to personal business.

She says what is most enjoyable about farming is "product upgrading." Her biggest challenges come from the poor weather conditions. Animals on her farm have been given the names of "Kamene."

Ruth was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Juhudi funds are the most favorable."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, to which she replied: "Micro-financed loans are always secured."

Her highest monthly expenses are business-related. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Ruth said it would enable her to provide more food for her family.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Ruth owns poultry and a bicycle but does not own a cow, pig, pump, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in her household a mosquito net, electricity, running water, sewing machine, TV and DVD but does not have solar power.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy a water tank.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is from Tiribe, Kenya. He is married and has five children, all of whom attend school.

Juma has a small grocery store. His sales are increasing and enabling him to earn a good income. With the help of his wife and his whole family, he is getting ahead in life with a lot of sacrifice and hard work. 

Juma is now a successful micro-businessman. He has a loyal and large customer base as a result of his kindness.

He is requesting a loan to buy food products, drinks, dairy products and other items he can sell in his store. This will allow him to continue to work and grow his business.

loans.use: to buy food products, drinks, dairy products and other items.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas (who is shaving his customer's head in the picture) is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as a courageous man. 

Nicholas operates a barber shop  where he provides haircut services. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive business area and his primary customers are the local residents. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving his business. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy shaving hair tools. His business goal is to improve his business within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy shaving hair tools for his barber shop.

loans.name: Penninah

texts.en:
Penninah is a 43-year-old married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be an ambitious woman.

She operates a retail business where she sells items such as sweets, bread, soda, water, etc. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located at a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business.

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy bread, sweets, soda and water to sell. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy bread, sweets, soda and water to sell

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 47 years old and separated from her husband. She is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She has four school-aged children. She is motivated to go into business so she can generate income.

Mary Jean is in a retail business. She owns and operates a specialized retail store locally known as a "sari-sari store" (similar to a convenience store), where she sells a variety of products in the local community. She has been in this business for about five years and she earns approximately 3,500 PHP each month. 

Currently, she went to GDMPC to request a loan in the amount of 10,000 pesos to purchase supplementary goods to sell. Mary Jean has a great plan for her family: she wants her children to finish college someday, so she saves a portion of her income for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase supplementary goods to sell

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah lives in the Nkubu area of Kenya, which hosts a campus at Mt. Kenya University. She has three children. She has been doing agricultural work for 15 years. Her primary income sources are derived from selling eggs, harvesting crops and providing transportation services.

She stated that what is most enjoyable about farming is "the outcome after harvest!" Her biggest challenge is theft, "especially of products before the harvest." One animal on her farm is named Nduma.

Monicah was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Juhudi has favorable repayment periods."  This client was also asked what she learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, to which she replied: "Micro-finance deals with small-scale farmers."

Her highest monthly expenses are family expenses. When she was asked how this loan will benefit her family, Monicah replied, "The family will earn more money due to high production."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Monicah owns poultry and a bicycle but does not own a cow, pig, pump, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in her household a mosquito net, running water and a TV but does not have electricity, solar power, a sewing machine or a DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy piglets.

loans.name: Njeri

texts.en:
Njeri lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which is situated near Nairobi. She has been in active farming for 20 successive years, with farming being the main source of income to meet family needs. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea and crops. She gets milk both from dairy cows and dairy goats.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Milking!' Her biggest challenge is 'Feeding the cows.' She has named one of her goats 'Brown.'

Njeri was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'because their terms and conditions are fair.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: 'a client must be in an organised group.'

Her highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Njeri replied 'Increase in income will improve the living standard of her family.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Njeri owns the following: 'cow and poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV or DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is married with four children. He lives in Tiribe and sells fish which he fishes himself. He has done this for approximately two years.

He tells us that he has everything he needs in order to do this work.  He also tells us that this job has helped him to help his family with the household costs and to get them ahead. He is a very hardworking person who has always taken pains to get ahead and succeed.

He is requesting this loan for the purchase of bales of fish to increase stock in his business. He thanks Yehu Microfinance for this opportunity

loans.use: to purchase bales of fish to increase stock in his business.

loans.name: Deolinda

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 3 filhos todos frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É docente e quadro do Ministério de Educação.Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra, ferro, e outros) para remodelar e ampliar a sua residência. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e construir um estabelecimento comercial, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é conseguir manter se saudável para garantir a execução de seus projectos.
texts.en:
Deolinda is single and the mother of 3 children who all go to School, lives in her own house and doesn't support anyone else.

She is a teacher and a permanent employee and the Ministry of Education. With this loan she intends to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, stone, iron and others) to remodel and expand her house.

In future she hopes to complete the building work on her house and build a commercial establishment. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to stay healthy so as to guarantee she can carry out her projects.

loans.use: purchase construction materials (cement, sand, stone, iron and others) to remodel and expand her house.

loans.name: Stella's Group

texts.en:
Stella's group is comprised of 2 hardworking women. Stella is 19 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past 4 years, Stella has been working hard to manage her bar, which offers up beers for sale. 

To help expand her business, Stella has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to improve on the business and buy more drinks such as soda, beer, wine and spirits to sell, and will help Stella to generate greater profits and be in position to provide for herself. Stella hopes that in the future she will be able to buy household requirements. 

Stella is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to improve on the business and buy more drinks such as soda, beer, wine and spirits to sell

loans.name: Grisha

texts.en:
Grisha, who is 53 years old, lives with his wife and son in Vanadzor city. He has a daughter who is married and lives separately from her parents.

An engineer who graduated from Vanadzor Engineering College but never worked at his profession, Grisha was formerly employed as a driver, but has now been a successful trader for more than 15 years. He buys apples, grapes, peaches, pears, tomatoes, cucumbers, potatoes, etc. from Artashat and Ejmiatsin, transports them with his own car and sells from a rented stall in Vanadzor city. His wife greatly helps him in this occupation.

Grisha is now requesting a loan of 500,000 Armenian Dram to buy more vegetables and fruits for the spring selling season. He uses part of his income to provide for his family, while saving some for his son's upcoming wedding party.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits to resell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which is a heavy pineapple-producing region. She has three children and has been working as a farmer for 10 years.  Her primary sources of income are tea, crops, and personal business.

Nancy says the most enjoyable part of farming is 'watering my plants!'. Her biggest challenge is 'getting water from the river to irrigate'. Her animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Jesse.'

Nancy was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, and she replied: 'Their terms and conditions are fair.'  She was also asked what she had learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, and she said that: 'Loan must be paid on the agreed day.'

Nancy's highest monthly expense is school fees for her children. When she is asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Nancy says 'I will be able to educate my children because I will have more income.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Juhudi Kilimo also uses this evaluation to measure any change in living standards resulting from the loan. Nancy owns a cow, but does not own 'pig, poultry, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. She has in her household 'mosquito net, TV, DVD' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a dairy unit

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn, 55 years old and married to a fishermen, is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur where she has been selling fish and crabs caught by her husband for about three years. Each month she earns 3,500 PHP. She also has a sari-sari store.

In 2008, Merlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 7000 PHP that was used to purchase additional products to sell in her sari sari store, Merlyn is now requesting her fifth loan of 7000 PHP to purchase a pump boat used in fishing. She plans to put the additional revenue toward improving the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a pump boat used for fishing.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 3 filhos, apenas 1 frequenta a Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta a sua mãe que vive com ela.
É docente e quadro do Ministério de Educação comerciante. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material (cimento, areia, pedra, ferro, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa, dar continuidade aos estudos e tirar carta de condução, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é manter-se saudável para realizar todos seus projectos
texts.en:
Antonieta is married and the mother of 3 children, only 1 of whom goes to School. She lives in her own house and supports her mother who lives with her.

She's a teacher and a permanent employee at the Ministry of Education. With this loan she intends to buy construction materials (cement, sand, stone, iron and others) to continue the building work on her house.

In future she hopes to finish her house, continue her studies and obtain her driving license. To this end she commits to duly paying off her loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to stay healthy so that she can carry out all of her projects.

loans.use: buy construction materials (cement, sand, stone, iron and others) to continue the building work on her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a dairy unit and buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Rose Ann

texts.en:
Rose Ann works hard to support her family. She is single and has a recycled materials business in the Philippines.

Rose Ann requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy recycled materials, like used bottles, plastic, and scrap iron.

She has been in this business for two years now and also earns additional income from motorcycle transportation. In the future, Rose Ann would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials for her business, like used bottles, plastic, and scrap iron.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 4 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É negociante e dona do próprio negócio de venda de verduras. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar grandes quantidades de verduras para revender na RSA semanalmente. 
No futuro deseja fazer crescer o seu negócio trazendo coisas da RSA para revender em Maputo, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é ter fundos suficientes para investir mais no seu negócio.
texts.en:
Angelina is married and the mother of 4 children who attend School, lives in her own house and doesn't support anyone else.

She's a trader and owns her own business selling greens. With this loan she plans to buy large quantities of greens from South Africa to resell on a weekly basis.

In future she hope to grow her business by bringing more things from South Africa to resell in Maputo. To this end she commits to duly paying off her loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to have sufficient funds to invest more in her business.

loans.use: buy large quantities of greens from South Africa to resell on a weekly basis.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. She is a married mother of three children. She owns a tea tree farming business, a business which she has been operating for two years now. She also has an agricultural farm, dealing in maize, beans and potatoes in small scale.

She learnt about Milango through an employee who invited her to the group and she joined the group with an aim of accessing credit to better her business operations. The main challenge she faces is lack of water.

Janet is applying for a loan of 20,730 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for the business. Her extra income from the loan will be added to the savings to expand the agricultural business. Her five year plan is to increase the acreage of tea trees to produce about 15 tons of tea per year.

loans.use: to buy tea tree seedlings for the business.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.pt:
Viúva e mãe de 4 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta mais dois netos que vivem com ela.
É negociante e dona do próprio negócio de produtos diversos. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, pedra, ferro, blocos, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa para melhor confortar a sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio e ter de terminar com a sua obra.
texts.en:
Olivia is a widow and the mother of 4 children who attend School. She lives in her own house and supports two grandchildren who live with her.

She's a trader and owns her own business selling various products. With this loan she plans to buy construction materials (sand, cement, stone, iron, blocks and others) to continue the building work on her house.

In future she hopes to complete her house to provide her family with more comfort. To this end she commits to duly paying off her loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to finish the building work.

loans.use: buy construction materials (sand, cement, stone, iron, blocks and others) to continue the building work on her house.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 2 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É negociante e dona do próprio negócio de produtos de primeira necessidade. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, pedra, ferro, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e construir um murro de vedação, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é conseguir maior financiamento para realizar os seus projectos
texts.en:
Sonia is married and the mother of 2 children who attend School. She lives in her own house and doesn't support anyone else.

She's a trader and owns her own business selling basic products. With this loan she plans to buy construction materials (sand, cement, stone, iron and others) to continue the building work on her house.

In future she wishes to complete her home and build a wall around it. To this end she commits to duly paying off her loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to get more financing to make her projects a reality.

loans.use: buy construction materials (sand, cement, stone, iron and others) to continue the building work on her house

loans.name: Hamid S's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva, based in the northern city of Makeni, is very pleased to present to you this group of able and dedicated teachers, located in the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. 

This group of teachers has applied for a loan of SLL 13,200,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to meet their immediate and most pressing needs. And at the end of each month, they can repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Hamid is the featured leader of this group. A native of Gbendembu, in northern Sierra Leone, the 54-year-old man is married to a teacher and the couple have six children. Hamid has served in the teaching profession for ten years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy building materials for the improvement of his dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy building materials for the improvement of his dwelling house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 63-year-old married man. He has 5 children with ages ranging from 18 to 26 years old. He describes himself to be hard working man. He operates a farm stand where he sells Napier grass, cabbages, bananas, kale, etc. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in a productive business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough finances to boost his business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a cow. His business goal is to improve his business with a goal of an operating income of KES 100,000 within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM after repaying a loan of KES 10,000.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is 48 years old, married, with one child.

Aurora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items such as bread, soft drinks, soap, sugar, and other groceries.

Aurora has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from tricycle transportation. Aurora aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy for her general store, items such as bread, soft drinks, soap, sugar, and other groceries.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, which lies in the northern part of the Rift Valley. He has 3 children and has been farming for 12 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and transportation services.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming is feeding the dairy cows to improve their productivity! His biggest challenge is diseases and lack of animal pasture during dry seasons. Animals on the farm have been given the names of Maua and Upendo.

Moses was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied that he learnt that they give loans to farmers at a lower interest rate as compared to other Micro Financial Institutions. This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. He answered that they are loans given to small scale farmers and businesses.

His highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked how this loan benefit your family, Moses replied that the income generated from the sale of milk will help me to pay school fees for my children.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Moses owns the following a cow, poultry, bicycle, and motorcycle but does not own a pig, pump, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household, a mosquito net, and TV but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Akram

texts.ru:
Акрам   родился в 1969 году в сельской местности. Он женат и имеет четверых детей.  Акрам   не имеет высшего образования так как не смог учится в свое время.  Его вид деятельности заключается в том,что он ремонтирует обувь и гордиться этим. Он  начинал свою деятельность с 25 лет,  был учеником. На протяжении 5 лет работал с мастером (наставником) , затем арендовал отдельное помещения для услуг.  На сегодняшний день он пользуется спросом среди местного населения и также имеет небольшое количество учеников.  
На данный момент его мастерская в очень плохом состоянии и он решил отремонтировать помещение.  С этой целю он обратился в Арванд. Планирует на полученный кредит купить строительные материалы,отремонтировав помещение, создать хорошие условия себе и клиентам.  Выражает организации Арванд огромную благодарность.
texts.en: Akram was born in 1969 in a rural area. He is married and has 4 children. He does not have post-secondary education because he was unable to study in his younger years. He earns his livelihood by repairing shoes, and he is proud of his work. He began as an apprentice in this field when he was 25 years old. For 5 years he worked with a master cobbler (mentor), then he rented his own business premises. Now his services are in big demand and he has several apprentices. However, his workshop is in bad condition and he has decided to renovate it. For this reason, Akram has approached Arvand for a loan that will allow him to buy building materials so he can fix his place of business and create a better atmosphere for himself and his clients. He is very grateful to Arvand.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Olga

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 2 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta seus pais enviando dinheiro para auxiliar nas despesas alimentares.
É docente e quadro do Ministério de Educação. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (janelas, cimento, portas, areia, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e iniciar um negócio, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é iniciar o seu negócio para aumentar as suas receitas
texts.en:
Olga is married and the mother of 2 children who attend School, lives in her own house and supports her parents by sending them money to help with food expenses.

She's a teacher and a permanent employee of the Ministry of Education. With this loan she plans to purchase construction materials (windows, cement, doors, sand and others) to continue the building work on her house.

In future she wants to complete her house and start a business. To this end she commits to duly paying off her loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to start her business to increase her income.

loans.use: purchase construction materials (windows, cement, doors, sand and others) to continue the building work on her house.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a very hard worker and, thanks to her effort and sacrifice, in addition to her hard work, she has been able to get ahead.

Thanks to the help she received from Kiva and Yehu Microfinance Trust, she has been able to continue to grow and provide better care to her customers. 

Kwekwe is requesting a loan for the purchase of more dried fish. She needs to continue to supply her business and offer a good variety to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish.

loans.name: Natasha

texts.ru:
Наталия уже пользовалась  финансовой помощью КИВА. Предыдущий кредит способствовал тому, что ассортимент и круг клиентов Наталии увеличился. Тем не менее, Наталия не хочет, чтобы бизнес останавливался на этом уровне.  
Наталия планирует использовать полученную от КИВА сумму в 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить сумки, ремни и увеличить тем самым свой ассортимент, оборот и уровень жизни всей семьи.
texts.en: Natalya has used Kiva's financial assistance in the past. Her previous loan allowed her to expand the range of goods she sells and increase her clientele. Nevertheless, she does not want her business to plateau. She plans to use a Kiva loan of 5,000 Ukrainian Hryvnya to stock up on handbags and belts which will allow her to increase her assortment of goods and her turnover, and improve the standard of living of her whole family.

loans.use: to buy handbags and belts

loans.name: Obadias

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 12 filhos dos quais 2 frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É operário numa empresa de fabrico de bananas e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, chapas, ferro, barrotes, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir e mobilar a sua casa, e adquirir uma viatura para os negócios, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é manter-se saudável para realizar todos seus projectos.
texts.en:
Obadias is married and father of 12 children, 2 of whom attend School. He lives in his own house and doesn't support anyone else.

He's a factory worker in a company that produces bananas and with this loan he plans to buy construction materials (cement, metal sheets, iron, beams and others) to continue the building work on his house.

In future he wishes to complete his house, furnish it and buy a vehicle for his business. To this end he commits to duly paying off her loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to stay healthy so as to carry out all of his projects.

loans.use: buy construction materials (cement, metal sheets, iron, beams and others) to continue the building work on his house.

loans.name: Rahmon

texts.ru:
Рахмон живет в сельской местности, в далёком от города селе. Рахмон занимается строительством  и ремонтом домов, а также он имеет небольшой  опыт в сфере животноводство. Он начал бизнес по откорму скота с одной коровы и постепенно развивал этот бизнес.  Эта корова давала молоко, которое Рахмон продавал и на эти деньги он покупал корм.    Поначалу ему было нелегко, особенно в зимнее время, когда вся земля была покрыта снегом и приходилось тратить больше средств на корм скота.  Но годами опыт доказывал своё и Рахмон стал находить пути решения препятствий и способы для лучшего продвижения своего дела. Теперь на сегодня он имеет более 30  голов крупно рогатого скота. Его жена и пятеро детей также помогают ему в этом деле. 
 Рахмон нуждается в дополнительных средствах для  приобретения новых скотов. С этой целью он обратился в МДО «Арванд» за кредитом. На полученный кредит планирует купить скот для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Rahmon lives in the rural area, in a village far away from town. Rahmon works in construction and house renovation; he also has some experience raising livestock. He launched his livestock business by buying a single cow and developing this business further. The cow produced milk, which Rahmon sold to buy feed. At first things were hard for him, especially during wintertime, when the ground would be covered with snow and he would have to spend more on feed. But, as time went by, he gained experience, and started finding solutions and means to manage his business better. At present he has over 30 heads of cattle. His wife and five children also help out in this business. Rahmon needs additional means to buy more cattle. This is why he applied to MDO Arvand for a loan. He plans to use this loan to buy cattle for growing his business further.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Jahon

texts.ru: Джахон проживает в Спитаменском районе. Ей 60 лет. Она замужем и мать троих детей. Ее старший сын с женой находятся в России на заработках. Сама Джахон занимается животноводством, уже более 15 лет. Она покупает коров и телят, откармливает их и затем продает с наценкой. Джахон хочет увеличить поголовье своего скота и расширить свою деятельность. С этой целью она обратилась в организацию за кредитом для закупа крупно-рогатого скота.
texts.en: Jahon lives in the Spitamen region. She is 60 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her eldest son and his wife are currently in Russia as migrant workers. Jahon has worked in animal husbandry for over 15 years. She buys calves and cows, fattens them, and then sells them for a profit. She now wants to increase her herd and expand her business. For this reason, Jahon has approached our organisation for a loan so she can purchase cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Nelson

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 1 filho que frequenta a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É funcionário público e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (pedra, areia, cimento, varões, e outros) para a construção de uma mercearia. 
No futuro deseja ser um comerciante de sucesso, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é conseguir fundos suficientes para desenvolver mais o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Nelson is married and the father of 1 son who attends School, lives in his own house and doesn't support anyone else.

He's a public servant and with this loan he plans to buy construction materials (stone, sand, cement, beams and others) for the construction of a grocery store.

In future he wants to be a successful businessman and to this end he commits to duly paying off her loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to obtain sufficient funds to develop his business.

loans.use: buy construction materials (stone, sand, cement, beams and others) for the construction of a grocery store.

loans.name: Nehemias

texts.en: Nehemias is 49 years old, married, and the father of seven children. His wife is a housekeeper and takes care of their children. Nehemias is in a service-based business, providing appliance repairs to local community members. To earn a living, Nehemias repairs television sets, radios and other appliances. He has been in this business for seven years. He earns PHP 2,300 a month from this work. Nehemias has applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase testing equipment to be used in repairing appliances. Nehemias plans to expand his shop.

loans.use: to purchase testing equipment to be used in his appliance repair business.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en: Saumu, from Tiribe, Mombasa, is married. She is the owner of a store in her house, which has regular customers. She is a hard worker whose goal is to be able to continue expanding in order to be able to continue helping her family and to take care of day-to-day expenses. She is applying for this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of supplies for her store and thus continue working and earning more.

loans.use: buy supplies for her store.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is married and has one child who doesn’t go to school. She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of UGX 200,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She works from her home and sells at retail to all categories of people. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to  become a wholesaler, and also to build rental rooms. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Rent is her monthly expense.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: construction materials (metal sheets, beams, cement, rods and others) to build the roof of his house.

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en: Nelfa is a married woman with two children. She is 56 years old and resides in Margos, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte, in the Philippines. The previous loan taken out by Nelfa was used to buy additional products to sell. Her sari-sari store, or general store, runs well. The income that is generated is very healthy. She was able to repay her obligation and to apply a portion of the income to supply her family’s basic needs. Now Nelfa is applying for a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle, which is used for transport local community members. Motorcycle transport locally known as "habal-habal." Nelfa plans to buy another motorcycle for transport.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle, which she uses to transport to members of her community.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is 32 years old, married, and blessed with four children. He owns a cafeteria and has been in business for the past twelve years. He was previously employed in a hardware shop. He describes his business as very productive. He is very hard-working and faithful. He hopes to open a catering business. He has applied for a loan of 32,298 KES to buy beans, maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and baking powder.

loans.use: to buy beans, maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and baking powder for his cafeteria.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 11 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta mais um irmão que vive na mesma zona que ele.
É docente e quadro do Ministério de Educação. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (pedra, areia, cimento, varões, e outros) para a dar continuidade a obra de dependências para os seus filhos. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua obra e construir uma mercearia, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a formação dos filhos.
texts.en:
Pedro is married and the father of 11 children who attend School. He lives in his own house and supports a brother who lives in the same area as him.

He's a teacher and a permanent employee of the Ministry of Education. With this loan he plans to buy construction materials (stone, sand, cement, rods and others) to continue to build a house for his children.

In future he hopes to finish this house and build a grocery store. To this end, he commits to duly paying off his loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to provide an education for his children.

loans.use: buy construction materials (stone, sand, cement, rods and others) to continue to build a house for his children.

loans.name: Cholponai

texts.ru: Чолпонай 54 года. После развала СССР и расформирования коллективных хозяйств, Чолпонай получила свою долю земли. И так с 1992 года Чолпонай организовала свой бизнес с 5,000 KGS. С тех давних времен Чолпонай в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Чолпонай , ее бизнес,позволяет ей иметь прибыль в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов еще ежегодно имеет доход от полеводства примерно 50,000 - 100,000 KGS взаимозависимости от сезона. На сегодняшний день, в ее хозяйстве имеется 2 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, также Чолпонай возделывает 2,40 га поливной земли, где выращивает перец и многолетние травы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чолпонай обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 5 телят для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Чолпонай планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса. Данный проект позволить осуществить давнюю мечту, приобрести автомобиль.
texts.en: Cholponai is 54 years old. After the fall of the USSR and the dismantling of the collective farm system, she received a portion of land, which is how she ended up starting her own business in 1992 with a sum of just 5,000 Kyrgyzstan Som. Since that time, she has been working in animal husbandry and growing crops. Thanks to her hard work, her business brings in a monthly profit of 15,000 Som from the sale of milk and dairy products, and the sale of crops generates an annual income between 50,000 and 100,000 Som, depending on what kind of season it has been. Currently, her farm includes 2 dairy cows, 2 horses, and 2.4 hectares of land where she grows peppers and perennial herbs. For the purpose of further developing her business, Cholponai has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 13,000 Som to buy 5 heifers to fatten and sell. Her long-term plan for the income generated by this loan is to expand her business, and in the short term, it will allow her to realise a long-cherished dream of buying a car.

loans.use: To purchase 5 heifers

loans.name: Rossana

texts.en:
Help Rossana launch her new editorial magazine and advance her publicity agency!

As the tumultuous politics of Venezuela began affecting the nation’s business market and investment opportunities, businesswoman Rossana decided it was time to close her successful advertising agency and immigrate to the U.S.  In August 2011, Rossana and her daughter moved to Miami to pursue a more stable and safer life. 

Drawing on her 15 years of experience as an editorial journalist and publicist, Rossana launched her own company.  Inversiones ALL Signs LLC offers consulting, website design, and concept development for businesses.  With her increasing success in Miami, Rossana is ready to take her business to the next level.  She is now in the process of developing Mango Magazine, a Spanish-language editorial publication celebrating Latin American culture and highlighting successful Latin entrepreneurs in the Miami area.  Rossana soon plans to hire three new employees to help the business grow – a graphic designer, a salesperson, and an administrative assistant.

While the success of Rossana’s new business is very important to her, her main goals remain centered on her family: to achieve economic stability, buy a home in the U.S., and send her daughter to college.

This loan will help Rossana to pay for office equipment and for the production of the first edition of her business’ new magazine.

loans.use: To publish the first edition of her new editorial magazine

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith, a married mother of four children ranging in age from 20 to 33 years, describes herself as a humble and determined woman. She has been operating a grocery store selling vegetables and fruits for 10 years now. Her business, located in a densely populated area, primarily attracts local customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business.

Now requesting her first loan with SMEP DTM for Kes 20,000, she will use it to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell. She hopes to expand her enterprise, her goal being to run another grocery store within five years.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. She is a married mother of three children. She owns a tea tree farming business. She also has an agricultural farm, dealing in maize, beans, potatoes, etc., in small scale, and this has been running for seven years.

She learned about Milango Financial Services through an employee who invited her to the group. She joined the group with an aim of accessing credit to better her business operations. The main challenges she faces are lack of water and theft of the farm produce.

Joyce is applying for a loan of KES 14,850 (Kenya shillings) to buy tea tree seedlings for the business. Her extra income from the loan will be added to the savings, to expand the agricultural business. Her future plan, in five years' time, is to open a cereals shop.

loans.use: to buy tea tree seedlings for her business.

loans.name: Mena

texts.en:
Mena sells oil, fried fish, and the fermented corn dough, kenkey, in Aburansa, near Elmina. Mena has received an education through a middle school level. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a tailor in their community. 

Mena has been selling oil, kenkey, and fried fish for four years now. Mena is responsible for helping to support her husband in paying their children's school fees and other family expenses. 

Her loan will be used to buy an increased quantity of corn, fish, and oil for the production of her prepared foods. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her food production business, to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity of corn, fish, and oil for the production of her prepared foods.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité La Esperanza empieza el primer ciclo, todas las señoras se dedican a la cría de animales de corral, como ser gallinas y cerdos también venden huevos y quesos. Las señoras se mostraron muy contentas y prometen trabajar todas juntas y llegar al máximo nivel del programa juntas.
Selva, es una de las miembros y la presidenta, con su esfuerzo trata de dar ejemplo y servir a sus compañeras. Ella también se dedica a la cría de animales y solicita este crédito para la compra de balanceados entre otros. Agradece a la fundación por la gran oportunidad que están recibiendo todas.
texts.en:
The group La Esperanza is beginning its first loan cycle.  All of the women make a living in raising farmyard animals, like chickens and pigs.  They also sell eggs and cheese.  The women are very happy and promise to work together to reach the program's highest level of achievement.

Selva is one of the group members, and she is also the president.  With her efforts, she tries to be an example in serving her group members.  She also makes a living in raising animals.  She is requesting this loan to buy animal feed, among other items.  

She is thankful to the foundation for the great opportunity that all the women are receiving.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and other items.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назире 37 лет, замужем, имеет 1 ребенка. Муж Назиры работает в Казахстане. Назира в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 20 лет, сразу после окончания школы начала занимается полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS) купив 1 теленка. Благодаря упорному труду Назиры в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 дойные коровы, 8 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Назира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 125,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 дойной коровы для увеличения надоев и 20 оевц для перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Назира планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность сделать дома ремонт.
texts.en: Nazira is 37 years old, married, and has 1 child. Her husband works in Kazakhstan. As the main breadwinner of the family, from the time she finished high school 20 years ago, she began working in animal husbandry and growing crops. She started her business with a sum of 10,000 Kyrgyzstan Som, buying 1 calf. Thanks to her hard work, her farm now includes 2 dairy cows and 8 sheep. For the purpose of further developing her business, Nazira has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 125,000 Som to buy 1 dairy cow to increase milk production, and 20 sheep for future re-sale.
