texts.fr: sophie est une femme de 58 ans, veuve et mère de 7 enfants dont le premier est agé de 35 ans et le dernier de 17 ans. elle possède et gère un stand dans un quartier de la ville où elle vend des poissons fumés. elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de matières premières afin de satisfaire sa clientèle grandissante. les bénéfices ainsi générés lui serviront pour agrandir son activité et assurer l'éducation de son dernier enfant qui va encore à l'école.
texts.en: Sophie is a woman of 58 years old. She is a widow and the mother of seven children, the oldest of whom is 35 years old and the youngest of whom is 17. Sophie owns and manages a stand in a district of her town where she sells smoked fish. She is requesting this loan to increase her stock of raw materials so that she can meet the demand of her growing clientele. The income Sophie earns with the help of this loan will serve to expand her business and provide for the education of her youngest child, who is still attending school.

loans.use: to purchase fish.

loans.name: Ramón Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro es un joven de 31 años, originario del municipio de El Sauce donde abunda la famosa leche y miel, soltero con una pequeña niña en edad escolar que se gana la vida desde muy joven, actualmente labora como Guarda de Seguridad y a pesar que es un trabajo muy riesgoso lo desempeña con mucho esmero y dedicación.

Trabajo que le permite darle lo mejor que puede a su única hija que es lo más valioso que tiene.

Hoy le da gracias a Dios por contar con un empleo cuando muchos en Nicaragua carecen de esto.

Debido a que por su bajo salario muchas veces no puede cubrir algunos gastos optó por solicitar un crédito en Ceprodel para comprar útiles escolares para su hija, ya que inició el año escolar y quiere dotarle de lo mejor para que no tenga ningún obstáculo en el camino de su aprendizaje.

Espera el apoyo de los inversionistas Kiva y Ceprodel para que le financien este préstamo y poder cumplir con esta inversión que es para el futuro de su hija.
texts.en:
Alejandro is a 31 year old young man. He is from the town of  El Sauce, where the famous milk and honey abound. He is single with a young school aged daughter. He has earned a living since he was very young. Right now, he works as a security guard. Despite it being a very risky job, he does it with much hard work and dedication. 

His job allows him to give the best that he can to his only daughter, who is the most valuable thing that he has. Today, he thanks God for having a job, when many in Nicaragua don't have one. 

Due to his low salary, sometimes he can't cover some expenses. He decided to ask for a loan from Ceprodel to buy some school supplies for his daughter. She began the school year and he wants to give her the best so she will have no obstacle in her road to learning. 

He hopes to have the support of the Kiva and Ceprodel investors so they will finance this loan and be can make this investment in his daughter's future.

loans.use: to buy his daughter school supplies

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José es soltero no tiene hijos, viven en casa en anticretico, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz.

El estudió hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente trabaja como socio propietario en una de las empresas de  Radio taxi de La Paz.

El crédito lo requiere para el arreglo del motor de su vehiculo y comprar llantas  nuevas, así mantendrá en buen estado su herramienta de trabajo.

El sueño de José es tener una segunda movilidad, así sus ingresos aumentaran y mejorara la calidad de vida.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: José’s single and has no children.  He lives in a house under the ‘anticrético’ modality [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you] located in the city of La Paz’s Llojeta zone.  He studied up to secondary school level and currently works as a member/owner in one of La Paz’s radio dispatched taxi firms.  He needs the loan to repair his taxi’s motor and to buy new tires so his work tool will be in good condition.  José’s dream is to own a second vehicle so his income will increase and his quality of life will improve.  This is the first time he’s requested a loan from IMPRO and from KIVA.

loans.use: to buy tires and to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Oldalia

texts.en: Oldalia is 38 years old and married with five children. She lives in Segatic Daku, Misamis Occidental. For over 10 years, she has owned and operated a charcoal selling business in the local community. She earns 9,000 PHP per month. Oldalia joined GDMPC in 2010. She is requesting a loan of 32,000 PHP for additional capital for her charcoal business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand the business into a coconut buying and selling business.

loans.use: to buy more chacoal

loans.name: Benvienida

texts.en: Benvienida is 52 years old and married with six children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting vegetables for sale in the local community to earn a living. She's been with her business over nine years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. She has joined GDMPC in 2011. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Gulanda

texts.ru: Гуланде 31 год, замужем. Вместе с мужем воспитывают четверых детей, младшей дочери 2 года. Основная деятельность семьи Гуланды – разведение скота и полеводство. Начатое практически с нуля 10 лет назад с момента создания семьи, хозяйство сегодня приносит около 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В Зимнее время Гуланда занимается торгоавлей овощей и фруктов на рынке. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота и для весенне пахотных работ, Гуланда обратилась в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота и удобрений для обработки земли для посева. Доходы от кредита Гуланда планирует вложить покупку дойных коров, что позволит ей увеличить свое хозяйство и в будущем отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Gulanda is 31 years old and married.  She and her husband are raising four children; their youngest is a two-year-old daughter.  The family mostly works in livestock and agriculture.  Beginning ten years ago with almost nothing, their business now brings in around 20,000 KGS a month from the sale of milk and dairy products.  In the winter time, Gulanda sells fruits and vegetables at a market.  With the goal of increasing the number of animals among her livestock and the work available during spring, Gulanda has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy livestock and fertilizer to cultivate the land for planting.  She plans to use the income from the loan to buy two dairy cows which will allow her to improve her financial position and, in the future, make repairs to her home.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and fertilizers

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
13 mujeres forman parte de este grupo que lleva por nombre “Mujeres Luchadoras”, ya que eso es lo que son, 13 mujeres que se esfuerzan por salir adelante y dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas necesitan.
Rosalba es miembro de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo. Tiene mucha habilidad con las comidas y es por ello que le está yendo muy bien, y gracias a eso ayuda a su familia y les da todo lo que necesitan para tener una vida digna.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser carnes, verduras, jamón, queso, condimentos y demás. Agradece por la ayuda que estan recibiendo, ya que les será de gran ayuda a ellas y sus familias.
texts.en:
13 women make up this group called “Mujeres Luchadoras” [Fighter Women]. That is what they are, 13 women who work hard to get ahead and give their families everything that they need.  

Rosalba is a member of this group. She works selling all types of food. She is very good at cooking and that is why it is going very well for her. Thanks  to that, she helps her family and gives them everything to have a dignified life.

She is asking for this loan to buy materials to be able to keep making her food, such as meat, vegetables, ham, cheese, condiments and more. She is grateful for the help she is getting, since it will be a big help to them and their families.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, ham, cheese, condiments and more.

loans.name: Aisuluu

texts.ru: Aйсулуу 35 лет, замужем, имеет 2 дочек. Айсулуу в качестве основного дохода с 1995 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 10,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Айсулуу в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 дойные коровы в приплодом, а также Айсулуу обрабатывает 1,0 га земли с картофелем и зерновыми культурами. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет около 15,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айсулуу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку теленка и 1 дойной коровы. Доходы от кредита Айсулуу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, чтобы в перспективе построить большой дом для своей семьи.
texts.en:
Aisuluu is 35 years old, married, and has two daughters. As the main source of income since 1995, Aisuluu has been engaged in raising livestock and cultivating crops, starting this business with 10,000 som. Through hard work, Aisuluu today has on her homestead two milk cows with offspring, and also 1.0 hectares of land with potatoes and grains. The monthly income from the business is about 15,000 som. 

In order to further develop her business, Aisuluu appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy a calf and a milk cow. Aisuluu plans to invest income from the loan to further increase the number of domestic animals, in order to in the long term build a big house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a calf and a milk cow

loans.name: Damai Slow Group

texts.en:
Group Leader, Piniah, 38, is married to Herman, who works as a driver. They have six children, including Inaya (9 years old) who's still going to school. 

Piniah's daily activities in business are selling bags, cosmetics, and household furniture. She has been working in this business for five years. Piniah sells her goods in a catalogue, in her community, and in the school of her child. Presently, Piniah has 30 loyal customers. She is enjoying this business because she can meet with many people. 

The other members of Damai Slow Group also have businesses, selling cooked food, selling cosmetics, and selling vegetables. 

Piniah has a dream to send her child to the university.

loans.use: to buy bags, home supplies, and accessories for her business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.fr:
Ce membre a intégré le banc villageois depuis son  cycle premier.
Elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants dont 5 garçons et 5 filles dont le plus âgé a 27 ans et le cadet 6 ans et scolarisé.
Elle s'active dans le commerce depuis longtemps et dispose d'une bonne éxpérience dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis longtemps.
Son nouveau crédit 365000 francs cfa lui permettra de payer des paniers de poissons séchés secs et frais. Mais également des sacs de légumes qu'elle va revendre au détail au niveau du marché central de la ville.
Son 9 crédit lui permettra de renforcer son activité génératrice de revenus.
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettront de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants mais également de renforcer ses épargnes dans le but de payer un véhicule de transport à son mari qui est embauché comme chauffeur actuellement par une tiers personne.
texts.en:
Aida has been a member of her local "banc villageois" since its first loan cycle. She is married and the mother of ten children, five boys and five girls. Her oldest is 27 years old and her youngest is six years old and attends school.

Aida has excellent experience in her field due to having been a merchant for quite some time. Her new loan of 365,000 XOF will allow her to purchase baskets of dried and fresh fish. Aida also plans to buy sacks of vegetables that she will resell at the city's central market.

Aida's ninth loan will help her to expand her business. The income she earns will help Aida to pay for the nutrition, health and education of her children. She will also be able to increase her savings with the aim of purchasing a transport vehicle for her husband, who is employed as a driver by a third party.

loans.use: to purchase dried and fresh fish and sacks of vegetables for her small business.

loans.name: Damira

texts.ru: Дамире 45 лет. Дамира в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи после развала СССР в 1992 году   начала заниматься животноводством. Начатый с суммы 5,000 KGS бизнес благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости Дамиры, на сегодня насчитывает 3 коровы, 1 лошадь и 10 голов мелкого рогатого скота и приносит доход около 15,000 сом в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Дамира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 16 голов овец и 2 теленка. Доходы от кредита Дамира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса за счет увеличения количества бизнеса.
texts.en:
Damira is 45 years old. Since the fall of the USSR in 1992, Damira has been engaged in raising livestock as a main source of income for her family. Started with a sum of 5,000 KGS, the business, through Damira's hard work and perseverance, today constitutes three cows, one horse, and ten heads of sheep, and brings in about 15,000 som per month. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Damira appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 130,000 som (KGS) to buy 16 heads of sheep and two calves.

Damira plans to invest income from the loan to further expand her business by increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase 16 sheep and two calves

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назире 41 год, не замужем, воспитывает одного сына ему 5 лет. В поисках источника пропитания для семьи, 16 лет назад Назира начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве со стартовой суммой 8,000 сом (KGS). По мимо этого Назира занимается торговлей продуктами питания. Благодаря упорному труду Назиры, на сегодня ее хозяйство приносит около 12,000 сом (KGS) месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов, полеводство приносит около 100,000 KGS по сезону. Для дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Назира обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 бычков для увеличения дохода от перепродажи скота. Доходы Назира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en:
Nazira is 41 years old, unmarried, and is raising one five-year-old son. 

In search of the source of sustenance for the family, Nazira started her own business 16 years ago in livestock and crop cultivation with a starting sum of 8,000 som (KGS). Alongside this, Nazira is engaged in selling food products. Through Nazira's hard work, her farm today brings in about 12,000 som (KGS) monthly from the sale of dairy and meat products, and crop cultivation brings in about 100,000 KGS per season. 

In order to further expand her business, Nazira appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy four bulls to increase income through reselling cattle. 

Nazira plans to invest income in further expanding her farm.

loans.use: to purchase four bulls

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married mother of two children. She runs a clothes shop which has been operating for three years.  She also supplies cotton bags.

Evaline was introduced to Milango by her friends, and she joined to access credit. She is applying for a loan of 85,900 Kenyan shillings to purchase new clothes and cloth items for sale, e.g., curtains, dresses, trousers and shirts.

She believes the income from this loan will help her to educate her children. She is focused on owning a wholesale shop, despite the challenge of bad debts.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes and cloth items for sale, e.g., curtains, dresses, trousers and shirts

loans.name: Anggur Star Group

texts.en:
Apong is 36 years old and lives in Cawang, Jakarta with her spouse and three children. Apong runs her business as a tailor and she also has a business selling vegetables in the morning in front of her house. Her latest business is still running this month. Apong's husband is a hospital labourer, but his income is not enough to fulfill her household needs while all of her children are attending school.
Apong, as a member of 2-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner VisionFund Indonesia in order to use it to increase their capital.
For the past 5 years she has been running her tailoring business. Her income plays a vital role for the family.

She wants the financing to purchase tailor utilities; thread, rubber bands, linen-sheet drapery, pillowcase drapery, and some kind of vegetables for her latest business. Presently she is facing a very difficult time because her husband is sick now and she needs more money to buy medicine. She has already sold their vehicle, and needs more money for their children's school fees also. Therefore she hopes that the loan will be a positive one for her so that she can put aside some savings for the future. And she has plans to sell various fish because she has a pond at her house.

loans.use: to buy material for linen sheets, material for pillows, buy rubber bands, and vegetables

loans.name: Nuevo Porvenir 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Arianny is the coordinator of her group, Nuevo Porvenir (New Future) 1, 2 & 3. This group is comprised of 15 entrepreneurs (women and men) and is located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris. Their community is a rural area, surrounded by fields of sugarcane. Arianny works selling miscellaneous products, such as clothes, cosmetics and shoes. She will use her part of this loan to make purchases to increase her inventory. 

Arianny is a single woman. Her most important challenges are to have a successful business and to start her own family. She will make it possible by working hard. She is receiving her eighth loan from Esperanza Internacional, and because her previous loan repayments have all been made punctually, she has been able to grow her business with the new investment she makes from each loan. 

She started her business almost four years ago, by taking loans and investing the money in her business. She would like to save her profits for bigger investment in the future. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy clothes, cosmetics and shoes for resale to customers

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita is 37 years old and lives in Mohon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two children. To earn a living, Melita grows crops, including vegetables. She earns about PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of work.

Melita has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase fertilizer for her crops. She has been a member of PMPC for eight years. Melita would like to have more savings in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy national newspapers and some types of magazines,  women's magazines, and some tabloids

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She owns a grocery shop, a business which has been running for seven years. 
She learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are high purchase costs and competition from the established businesses. 
Rehema is applying for a loan of 15,850 Kenya shillings to buy grocery stock e.g. potatoes, cooking oil etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the living standard of her family, and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy grocery stock e.g. potatoes, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Kavuna

texts.en:
Kuvuna lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. She has one child. She owns a charcoal and fuel wood business, a business which she has been operating for ten years. Kuvuna is also a farmer.
She learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is the effects of the low season.
Kuvuna is applying for a loan of 15,900 Kenya shillings to buy fire wood and charcoal. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on her living standard, used for personal issues and to provide the family with their basic needs.

loans.use: To buy fire wood and charcoal.

loans.name: Ria

texts.en:
Ria is married with four children. Ria is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Ria is a farmer and grows crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for eight years. She has requested a loan to purchase more fertilizer for her crops.

Ria has been a member of PMPC for a year.  In the future, Ria hopes that her children will finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizer

loans.name: Belen

texts.en: Belen is married with two children. Belen is 44 years of age and lives in Upper Bag-ong Tudela Josefina Zamboanga del Sur. Belen has a general store business to earn a living and has had this business for seven (7) years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. She has requested a loan to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, vinegar, and salt. Belen has been a member of Paglaum MPC for almost two years. In the future, Belen hopes to expand the inventory of the store.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, vinegar, and salt.

loans.name: Lennox

texts.en:
Lennox lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has one school-going child. He owns a food cafe which he has been operating for five years. In this café, he sells fries. He also owns a motorcycle which provides transport in the area. He employs four other people in the café.
Lennox learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are competition and the effect of season changes. 
Lennox is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy food stock e.g. rice, cereals, wheat flour, cooking fat etc. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to pay school fees for his child and improve on his living standard. His dream is to open another food cafe.

loans.use: to buy food stock e.g. rice, cereals, wheat flour, cooking fat etc.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She owns a retail shop, a business which has been running for six years. Jane employs two other people in the business. She also sells clothes.
Jane learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit in order to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are competition from established shops and bad debts. 
Jane is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy retail stock e.g. rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil etc. and clothes. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the living standard of her family and pay school fees for her children. Jane would like to own a larger boutique and wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy retail stock e.g. rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil etc. and clothes.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.en:
Yawa lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has four children, two of whom are in school. Yawa owns a motorcycle which provides transport in the area. Owing to dwindling income, he intends to widen his income sources. Yawa would like to invest in selling charcoal. 
He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is the effect of season changes. 
Yawa is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings to purchase a stock of charcoal for sale. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to pay school fees for his children and to improve on his living standard.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is married and has two children. Pablita is 64 years old and lives in Señor, Sinacaban, Mis. Occ., Philippines. She sells a variety of products to earn a living, and she has had her business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this work.

She has requested a loan for 6,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell in her store, such as soft drinks, noodles, and milk. Pablita has been a member of PMPC for four years. Pablita hopes to save money, for any emergencies that may arise in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, such as soft drinks, noodles, and milk

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia  is married and has four children. She is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a farmer and grows crops, including vegetables, to earn a living. She has been doing this work for three years.

Cynthia has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer for her crops. She has been a member of PMPC for three years.

She hopes to improve her family's living conditions, in the future, by building up savings.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is married with three children. She is 57 years old and lives in Casusan, Aloran Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Corazon is engaged in a general store business to earn a living and has had this business for 35 years. Each month, she earns PHP 25,000 doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of PHP 49,900 to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, and vinegar.

Corazon has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, she hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, and vinegar.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Sherly is 52 years old and lives in Locsoon, Tudela, Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Sherly has a shop selling glass and aluminum; she has had this business for five years. Sherly has been a member of PMPC for three years, and she has requested a loan to purchase additional materials for the business.

In the future, Sherly hopes to financially support immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her glass and aluminum business.

loans.name: 12 De Junio Group

texts.es:
El grupo 12 de Junio está en su ciclo  20, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 6 mujeres se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Nancy quien se encuentra en el nivel rojo de su encuesta. Ella cuenta que a parte de su peluquería, se dedica a vender bijouterie. Ella es una persona que se esfuerzan mucho por salir adelante, es por eso que hace todo tipo de trabajo para poder crecer y mejorar sus ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia. Su sueño es poder tener una gran peluquería y de esa forma también poder dar trabajo a otras personas que lo necesiten.
La Sra. Nancy con este crédito desea comprar  nuevos insumos para su peluquería, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group "12 de Junio" (June 12th) is in its 20th cycle. All work together and help one another to get by. In doing a poverty elimination survey, they found that six women are living below the poverty line. 

One of the members who is at the red level is Ms. Nancy. She states that apart from her beauty salon, she also sells jewelry. She is a person who puts forth a lot of effort to get by, and for this reason she does all kinds of work in order to increase her profits in order to help her family. Her dream is to have a bigger beauty salon, and in this way she could also give jobs to other people who need them.

Ms. Nancy would like to use this loan to buy new supplies for her beauty salon, which would help in finalizing her business plan and increase profits.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a beauty salon, such as shampoo, conditioners, lotions, dyes, etc.

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en:
Nyevu lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has six grown up children. She owns a cafe, a business which has been running for five years. She employs two other people in the business. Nyevu also owns a greengrocer stall.
She learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are the effects of low season. 
Nyevu is applying for a loan of 31,500 Kenya shillings to renovate the café, buy utensils and grocery/food stock e.g. rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the living standard of her family. Nyevu would like to own a larger boutique and wholesale shop.

loans.use: To renovate the cafe and to buy utensils and grocery/food stock eg. rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en:
Celestine lives in Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has four children, three of whom are in school. She owns a retail shop, a business which has been running for six years. 
She learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are high purchase costs and competition from the established businesses. 
Celestine is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings to buy retail stock e.g. rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the living standard of her family and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy retail stock e.g. rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson lives in the Malindi area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has four children, three of whom are school going. He owns a tailoring shop; a business he has been operating for two years. Johnson also owns rental houses from which he earns some income.
He learnt about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group and he joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve on his business operations. His main challenge is competition from established businesses.
Johnson is applying a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy sewing machines and tailoring materials. He will use the extra income to improve the standard of living of the family.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines and tailoring materials.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
This is Ruel, 31, a resident of Dasma, Cavite Philippines. He is married to Elizabeth, his business partner and he is a father to their children. By the grace of God, he has managed to support all his children’s educational needs. At the present time, he is working hard to be able to maintain his finances for his family.

Ruel operates an auto repair shop and he is also the main mechanic. They offer repair, check-up, beautification, painting and tinting of all types of cars,  jeepneys, and any type of vehicle that is referred to them.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. He will be using the loan to buy supplies like wirings, putty paint, tint and other materials needed in his repair shop.

Ruel hopes to expand his business and dreams of giving his children a good quality education. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his life and business every week and finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for supplies like wiring, putty paint, tint and other materials needed in an auto repair shop.

loans.name: Kunduzkan

texts.ru: Кундузкан 38 лет, замужем и воспитывает шестерых детей. Старшему из детей 18 лет. Кундузкан по специальности повар, но учитывая небольшую зарплату повара, она не решила работать по специальности.с 1997 года, Кындузкан решила начать свой собственный бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве. При стартовом капитале в сумме 6,000 KGS, Кундузкан приложила огромные усилия в развития своего бизнеса и добилась успеха – на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имеется 1 лошадь, 5 голов овец и 5 голов коз. Ежегодно семья обрабатывает 15,0 га земли где сажают фасоль, картофель. Ежемесячный доход от перепродажи скота приносит около 6,000 KGS в среднем и от полеводства по сезону приносит от 100,000 KGS 200,000 KGS. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса , Кундузкан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на приобретения 1 дойное коровы и грубые сорта кормов . В будущем, Кундузкан мечтает построить дом в городе Талас.
texts.en: Kunduzkan is 38 years old, married and is raising six children.  Her oldest is 18.  She is a trained cook, but considering the low pay, she decided not to pursue this sort of work.  In 1997, she decided to start her own business in livestock.  She began with only 6,000 KGS.  Thanks to her enormous efforts to develop the business, she has found success.  Today, she owns 1 horse, 5 sheep and 5 goats.  Each year, the family farms 15 hectares of land where they plant beans and potatoes.  Their business brings in around 6,000 KGS each month from reselling cattle and between 100,000 and 200,000 KGS per harvest.  In order to further develop her business, Kunduzkan has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 80,000 KGS to buy fodder and one dairy cow.  In the future, Kunduzkan dreams of building a home in the city of Talac.

loans.use: To purchase 1 milk cow and fodder

loans.name: Azizakhan

texts.ru: Азизакан благодарит от всей души всех инвесторов КИВА за то, что поддержали ее. Она смогла получить хороший доход от кредита.  Она смогла оплатить контракт детей.  В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Азизакан обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)на подготовку к весенне полевым работам. На заемные средства планирует приобрести семена и удобрений.
texts.en: Azizakan is thankful to all the Kiva investors for their support.  She was able to receive a good return on her loan, and to pay off her children's educational contracts.  In order to further develop her business, Azizakan has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 60,000 to prepare for spring field work.  With the funds from the loan, she plans to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Lleny

texts.es: Lleny, de 44 años de edad , esta casada con Juan quien es comerciante y padre de sus 4 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia la cual fue comprada con el fruto de su esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Lleny es la venta de bebidas tales como gaseosas, cervezas y aguas envasadas ,además cuenta con una refrigeradora que compró hace un tiempo el cual instaló en su hogar, desde allí  los atiende de manera amable y cordial ya que sabe que con ese trato se ganará la preferencia de sus clientes. Hasta el momento trabaja sola y le va muy bien por esta razón considera a su negocio bastante rentable ya que le deja muy buenas ganancias .Comenta que gracias a está actividad puede apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar y no depender totalmente de él.Actualmente, viendo los buenos resultados, tiene planes de continuar con su negocio y aumentar la mercadería para asi ver crecer su negocio.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000 soles ,el cual será invertido en la compra de aguas envasadas , gaseosas y cervezas de diversas marcas ,a su vez se muestra muy agradecida con el apoyo financiero que le brinda nuestra institución
texts.en:
Lleny, 44 years old, is married to Juan, who is a merchant and is the father of their four children. Together they live in their own house, which was purchased with the fruit of their labor. 

Lleny sells drinks such as soft drinks, beer and bottled water from a large cooler that she purchased some time ago and installed in her home. It is from there that she serves her customers in a friendly and cordial way, as she knows that this is the way to earn their loyalty. 

For now she works alone and is doing very well. She considers her business to be profitable since it brings her good earnings. She comments that thanks to this job she can help out her spouse with household costs and not be totally dependent on him.

Now, after seeing good results, she plans to continue with her business and increase her merchandise in order to help it grow. She would like to apply for a loan of 2000 soles, which she would use to purchase various brands of bottled water, soft drinks and beer. She in turn is very grateful for the financial support offered by this organization.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, bottled water and beer.

loans.name: Wendtoin Group

texts.fr:
Mme ASSETO représente le groupe WENDTOIN. Elle se porte bien ainsi que tout le groupe. Mariée, elle est mère de 05 enfants.  Le plus âgé a 26ans et le moins âgé a 07ans. 01 va à l’école et elle a 03 personnes en charge. 
Mme vend du poisson et du pain depuis 13ans. Elle s’approvisionne chez les grossistes au secteur 28 en ville. Ses clients sont les voisins, enfants, hommes et les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter  05 cartons de poisson et 03 bidons d’huile.
Avec ses bénéfices, Elle veut épargner. Comme ambition, elle veut agrandir son activité et aider son mari pour les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Asseto is the representative of the Wendtoin group and, like the rest of the members of the group, is in good health. She is married and a mother to five children; the oldest is 26 and the youngest 7 years of age. One of her children goes to school, and Asseto has three people under her care.

For the past 13 years Asseto has worked selling fish and bread. She gets her supplies from wholesalers in the area of town known as Sector 28, and her customers (who are from her neighborhood) are men, women and children.

Asseto wants to buy five boxes of fish and three drums of oil, and she plans to save the profits she makes. Her future plan is to expand her business, as well as to help her husband to provide for the family.

loans.use: To buy five boxes of fish and three drums of oil.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Arlyn works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling sand and gravel in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from raising pigs. Arlyn is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to pay a laborer's salary for her sand and gravel business.

Arlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for her laborer's salary

loans.name: Rakhat

texts.ru: Рахат 41 лет, вдова, воспитывает 5 детей. Старшая из детей дочка ей 21 год. После скоропостижной смерти мужа, Рахат с 2009 года занимается торговлей женской одежды. Начав этот бизнес с 20,000 KGS. Благодаря упорному труду и хорошего характера Рахат наработала много постоянных клиентов. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рахат обратилась в компанию «Бай–Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку весенне-летних вещей для женщин. Для того что бы увеличить доходы ей не хватает ассортимента и количества товара. Кредит от КИВА и Бай Тушум сможет ей помочь увеличить доходы.   Доходы от кредита Рахат планирует направить на оплату за обучения дочерей в университете.
texts.en: Rakhat is 41 years old, a widow and is raising 5 children.  The oldest is a 21-year-old daughter.  Since the sudden death of her husband in 2009, Rakhat has worked selling women's clothing.  She started her business with 20,000 KGS.  Now, thanks to her hard work and strong character, she has many clients.  Each month, her income is around 20,000 KGS.  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 KGS to buy women's spring and summer clothing.  She currently doesn't have the variety or inventory to increase her profits.  The loan from Kiva and Bai Tushum will help her.  With the new profits, Rakhat plans to pay her daughter's university tuition.

loans.use: To purchase spring-summer clothes for resale

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
This is Rowena, 40, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Charlie, an employee, and is a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rowena operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan to help her continue the operations of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Rowena dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita works hard to support six children. She is married and has a buy-and-sell vegetables and fruits business in the Philippines.

Lucita requested a PHP 1,800 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night. Lucita  is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Felix Atanacio

texts.es:
El señor Félix vive en Libertad, tiene 49 años de edad. Ella empezó su negocio con una pequeña tienda y gracias a Dios está cada día creciendo poco a poco. 

El empieza su negocio desde la mañana comprando legumbres frescas, para venderlas en su tienda. Este negocio lo realiza junto a su esposa todo el día.

Le teme a la delincuencia a pesar que en su negocio está todo cubierto ya que el señor tiene una finca en milagro y eso es otro ingreso de dinero. Está casado su esposa le ayuda en la finca y en la tienda, tiene hijos y ya son mayores de edad. 

Con el préstamo va a comprar viveres de primera necesidad y legumbres. Su sueño es su tienda siga creciendo ya que es su única forma de subsistir; para que su familia siga adelante.
texts.en:
Sr. Félix lives in Libertad and is 49 years of age. He established a small store as his business and every day, thanks to God, it has grown a little bit at a time each day.

Félix begins his work in the morning by purchasing fresh legumes to sell in his store. He and his wife manage the business together every day. Despite the fear of crime and the impact it has on his business, all of his needs are covered since he also has a farm in Milagro that serves as another source of income. Félix is married and his wife helps with the farm and the store. He has children who are already grown.

With this loan, Félix will buy basic provisions and legumes. His dream is for his store to continue growing since it serves as a form of sustenance. This will enable his family to continue moving forward.

loans.use: to buy basic provisions and legumes.

loans.name: Mayra Alexandra

texts.es:
La clienta Mayra vive en Guayaquil, tiene 33 años de edad. Ella empezó su negocio con un pequeño bazar y debido a que quería mayores ingresos fue incrementando su negocio poco a poco hasta adquirir ponerse una tienda.

El trabajo lo realiza sola de 6:30 de la mañana hasta 11:00 de la noche, lo que le preocupa en toda su vida son las enfermedades tanto de ella como la de sus hijos. Ya que sola trata de darles una vida mejor a sus hijos.

Esta soltera y tiene dos hijos uno de 10 años y el otro de 8 años quienes son el esfuerzo de la clienta para que sigan adelante.

Con este préstamo quiere comprar bloques, cemento para poder mejorar su casa y asi darle un mejor lugar donde vivir a sus hijos y tambien contrsuir mejor cierta parte de la tienda. En el futuro quiere con su negocio mayores ingresos de dinero.
texts.en:
Mayra is 33 years of age and lives in Guayaquil. She started her business with a small stationery shop and, as she wanted to have a higher income, she began gradually expanding her business until she was able to open a store. She works alone from 6:30 am until 11:00 pm, and her major concern throughout life has been the illnesses from which she and her children suffer. 

Mayra strives to offer her children a better life. She is single and has two children, aged 10 and 8, and she works hard to make sure that they get ahead in life. With this loan Mayra wants to buy cinderblocks and cement, so that she can improve her home and give her children a better place to live. She also wants to improve a part of her store. In the future, she would like her business to generate more income.

loans.use: To buy cinderblocks and cement.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for additional stock of merchandise like clothes, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.es: Robert, está casado, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos que son la mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar una maquina que necesita cambiar, pues la otra ya está muy antigua y deteriorada. El se dedica a trabajar en el arreglo de jardines y chapeo de patios. El tiene ya varios años de trabajar como jardinero y le va muy bien por lo cual quiere aumentar la cantidad de maquinas para trabajar. El tiene pensado aumentar sus trabajos y con esta máquina dar un mejor acabado a sus trabajo. El quiere darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida para su bienestar familiar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Robert is married and lives with his wife and two children who are his biggest priority. With the loan he plans to purchase new equipment which needs to be replaced, as his other equipment is old and deteriorating. He makes a living doing landscaping and gardening work. He has been working a number of years as a gardener and business is going well. For this reason he hopes to buy more equipment, take on more work, and, with better tools, be able to deliver a better finished product. He hopes to provide his family with a better quality of living. This is Robert's first loan from FUDECOSUR. He had not received previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase landscaping equipment

loans.name: Estanislao

texts.es: Doña Estanislao, tiene 60 años de edad, es madre soltera sus 4 hijos son independientes, vive junto a sus tres nietos en una aldea del municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Ella tiene 4 años de dedicarse a vender mercadería como ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, uniformes, también cosméticos como cremas, lociones, y otros que le piden sus clientes. Ella vende su mercadería de manera ambulante en la aldea y a sus alrededores, mediante pedidos por catalagos de productos AVON. Ha invertido varios préstamos para mantener estable su negocio, actualmente el préstamo que solicita es el séptimo ciclo  con ODEF y es por 13,000 lempiras, con el cual va  surtir de más mercadería de ropa y cosméticos para poder incrementar sus ganancias, aprovechando que viene la temporada de verano. Su propósito de trabajar con el negocio es para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Doña Estanislao is 60 years old and a single mother of four children who are independent. She lives with her three grandchildren in a neighborhood in the town of Tela, Atlántida.

For the past four years, Estanislao has sold merchandise such as clothing and uniforms for women, men, and children. She also sells cosmetics such as crèmes, lotions, and other items requested by her customers. Estanislao sells her merchandise as a traveling vendor in her neighborhood and the surrounding areas. She submits orders through Avon product catalogs.

Estanislao has invested several loans to keep her business stable. She is currently requesting her seventh loan from ODEF, which is in the amount of 13,000 HNL. The money will be used to restock her inventory of clothing and cosmetics so that she can increase her earnings. Estanislao will take advantage of the summer season. Her goal is to use the profits from her business to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Hog-raising is the primary source of income for Esmeralda. She has been running her hog-raising business for many years. She usually earns about PHP 7,500 every four to five months. She raises her four children through her business. 

Right now, she is asking a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for the proper growth of her hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for the proper growth of her hogs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lira

texts.ru: В преддверии весенне полевых работ Лира планирует заняться полеводством. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Лира запрашивает кредит в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) для приобретения семян, ГСМ и удобрений. В конце сезона планирует миеть доход в размере 150,000 KGS.
texts.en: In anticipation of spring field work, Lira plans to start cultivating the land.  To further grow her business, Lira is asking for a loan of 35,000 KGS to buy seeds, fuel and fertilizer.  At the end of the season, she expects the profits from her harvest to be 150,000 KGS.

loans.use: to purchase bean seeds, fuels and fertilizers

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr: Détentrice de bar et de boutique d’alimentation générale à Lomé, Améyo est âgée de 32ans et n’a pas d’enfants en charge. C’est en 2007 qu’elle a démarré son activité et sollicite son premier crédit pour le ravitaillement des produits alimentaires. Les profits supplémentaires vont permettent à cette dernière d’augmenter sa quantité de marchandises afin de satisfaire les besoins de ses clients. Elle voudrait ouvrir un bar annexe tout en assurant un avenir meilleur à sa future famille.
texts.en: Améyo is 32 years of age, has no children under her care, and owns a bar and general food store in Lomé. She started her business in 2007, and has requested her first loan to restock her food products. The additional profits generated will allow her to increase the quantity of merchandise she has, so that she can meet the needs of her customers. She would like to open an additional bar, so that she can provide a better life for her future family.

loans.use: To buy food products.

loans.name: Buenaventura Group

texts.es:
El comité tiene 19 integrantes, donde cada una de ellas se esfuerza por ir creciendo y ayudar a sus familias. Todas tienen la esperanza de seguir luchando por salir adelante, buscando el progreso de cada una de ellas y la de su comité.
Graciela, quien es parte de este grupo, cuenta que se dedica a la venta de medicinas naturales (yuyos). Ella cuenta que siempre vende muchos yuyos y que con eso ayuda a sus familiares, esta muy contenta con lo que hace ya que es un trabajo muy digno y por sobre todo honesto. Ella es consciente de que trabajando podrá llegar lejos, y es por eso que pone todo de ella.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de yuyos al por mayor, ya que así tendrá más ganancias y podrá surtirse para dar a sus clientes productos frescos  a los que están acostumbrados.
texts.en:
This committee is made up of 19 members and they each work to grow and help their families.  They all hope to continue moving ahead, finding their individual progress and their committee.

Graciela, who is part of the group, sells natural medicines (yuyos).  She says that she always sells many yuyos and helps her family in this manner.  She is very happy about her work because it’s dignified and above all honest.  She knows that she can go far through her work and she gives it her all.

She is asking for this loan to buy yuyos in quantity so she can have more earnings and be able to offer fresher products to her customers as they have become accustomed.

loans.use: to buy medicines.

loans.name: Pablino

texts.es:
El  Sr. Pablino es de la ciudad de Santaní,  tiene 40 años, está casado con la Sra. Blanca  de  24 años, y tienen 2 Hijos, todos aun pequeños que van a la escuela y por quienes ambos luchan para poder salir adelante y darles todo aquello que ambos no pudieron tener.
El tiene una Despensa en su casa y gracias a la buena variedad que tiene pudo formarse una buena clientela formada. El es una persona muy trabajadora y comenta que quiere seguir creciendo en lo que hace, y es por eso que se esfuerza al máximo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, leche, pan, fideos, arroz, verduras y demás insumos para poder seguir dando a su clientela la variedad a la que están acostumbrados.
texts.en:
Sr. Pablino is from the city of Santaní. He is 40 years old and married to Sra. Blanca, age 24. They have two young children who are in school, so both Pablino and his wife strive to get ahead and provide their children with everything they did not have.

Pablino has a food pantry in his house. Thanks to the good variety he offers, he has been able to establish a good clientele. He is a hardworking individual and says that he wants to continue growing in his current profession. For this reason, he strives to do his best.

Pablino is requesting this loan so that he can invest in the purchase of beverages, milk, bread, noodles, rice, vegetables, and other products so that he can continue offering his customers the variety that they are accustomed to having.

loans.use: to buy beverages, milk, bread, noodles, rice, vegetables, and other products.

loans.name: Subdra

texts.en:
Subdra is 45 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 30 and 26. In 2005, she established  her cow-raising business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supoorts her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan Business and Professional Women and used her most recent loan to buy a young milk-giving cow. In the future, Subdra plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about ten liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD 0.50. 

In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young milk-giving cow.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
This is Salvacion. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the needed products for her variety store. It also helped a lot with her everyday expenses. She continues to work for her family's sake.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in more profits. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Salvacion dreams that her business will continue to be successful. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for more stock of office/school supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
This is Ma. Victoria, 29, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ferdinand, a businessman, and is a mother to their child. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma. Victoria operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Ma. Victoria hopes her business will expand and grow. She dreams of having her own house and lot.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Pasencia

texts.en:
This is Pasencia. She previously accessed a PHP 19,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in funding her children’s education and her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan of PHP 21,000 to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Pasencia dreams to have a good life and a future for her children. She hopes that her business will expand. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a dried fish vendor from Bohol, Philippines. She has been in the business for more than 15 years. Susan needs a loan to buy more fish to dry and sell. With this, she will be able to increase her stock and sell more to the market. Susan hopes of expanding her business so that she can support the schooling of her 12-year-old son through her earnings from the business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to dry and sell

loans.name: Las Flores 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Lourdes is the coordinator of her group, Las Flores 1, 2 & 3 (The Flowers), located in Santiago, the second largest city in the Dominican Republic. This group is composed of 15 businesswomen, all dedicated to doing business around their community and in other neighborhoods in the city. Urban areas of the Dominican Republic are very overcrowded.

Lourdes and her long-term partner have two children and live in a simple home in Santiago. Lourdes sells Avon products; she shows the catalog to her clients and they order items from it. She also operates a food stall where she sells 'Riky' (a meatball sandwich, very popular on the north coast of the country) in the morning and at night. Lourdes will use this loan to invest in both businesses, by purchasing beef, bread, ketchup, mayonnaise and other ingredients for her food stall and by purchasing more inventory of popular and sales products for her Avon business.

This is Lourdes’s seventh loan with Esperanza International, and she hopes to continue taking out loans to grow her businesses and to improve her family's home life.

loans.use: To buy goods for her food stall and cosmetics from catalog products

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: A $600 loan is sought by Maria to improve her business. Maria is married and has six children, two of them in school. She opened her kiosk in 2008 with her own working capital of $100. She will use the loan to buy stock for her store such as oil, sleepers, detergent, soap, rice, sugar, coffee  and bread. Maria is generating a good income from selling. She has been thinking how to running a big business.

loans.use: To buy  oil, sleepers, detergent, soap, rice, soft drinks, bread, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Venciana

texts.en:
Venciana works hard to support her family. Venciana is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Venciana requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Venciana has been in this business for 26 years now.

In the future, Venciana would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
This is Edna, 47, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Larry and is a mother to their children. She, with the help of her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Edna operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php11, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Edna hopes to have a restaurant someday and dreams of being successful in life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables, and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
This is Mary Jane. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more sacks of rice and she was able to generate a higher income. She has been selling rice for five years now. Last year, she started another business where she supplies tires. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their family's everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy more stock of rice. She will also use it in buying tires. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mary Jane dreams that her children will finish their studies and hopes to buy a pick up. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of rice and tires for her business

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora has been engaged in selling ready-to-wear goods and items for more than 10 years now. She lives with her husband and children in Ubay, Bohol.
Teodora needs a loan to buy more products to sell like shirts, dresses, slippers, and other fashion accessories. With this loan, she will be able to improve her sales and profit. In the future, Teodora hopes to make her business a success and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell like shirts, dresses, slippers, and other fashion accessories

loans.name: Minife

texts.en:
Minife is 48 years old, married, and has one child who is in school. 

Minife is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a loan of PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Minife has been fattening pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Minife would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a responsible and industrious woman. She is 41 years of age, married, and has five children. Three of her children are laborers, one is studying, and the youngest is a special child. Analiza's husband is a farmer. The couple both work hard to earn a living.

Analiza has owned a retail store for four years and two months. Aside from selling merchandise, she also sell vegetables and viands within her local community. She wants to keep her business progressing and that is why she is asking for another loan in the amount of PHP 18,000. She will use it to buy merchandise such as assorted vegetables, cooking oil, three cases of soft drinks, vinegar and junk foods for her retail store. By offering a larger variety of merchandise, she can provide her costumers with satisfaction and earn a larger income.

loans.use: To buy assorted vegetables, cooking oil, three cases of soft drinks, vinegar, and junk foods for her retail store

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris, de 51 años de edad está casada con Tito, quien es obrero de construcción y padre de sus 2 hijos, por ellos se esfuerza en su trabajo para asi poder brindarles lo mejor y ver que no les falte nada. Vive en su casa propia , la cual fue construida con ayuda de su esposo.El trabajo que realiza Doris es la costura o confección de  prendas de vestir para todo tipo de ocasión, como polos, camisas, faldas, calzones , entre otros. Realiza el trabajo en su hogar ya que acondicionó un espacio especialmente para la exhibición de sus prendas. Se inició en esta labor porque estudió en un centro de educación ocupacional e invirtió su propio capital para pagar sus estudios , cuando tenía los conocimientos técnicos precisos compró máquinas de costura y materiales , asi empezó a dar sus primeros pasos en este negocio.Esta actividad la viene realizando hace más de 6 años, tiempo que le sirvió para ser reconocida entre sus clientes por la calidad e innovación en sus prendas. Considera a esta actividad rentable ya que con sus ganancias puede ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar y darles mayor comodidad a sus hijos.Nos comenta que antes de empezar con esta actividad tenía muchos problemas económicos razón por la cual espera seguir creciendo y convertirse en una próspera empresaria .En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles , está muy contenta de poder contar con el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo, ya que así avanzará con su negocio .Con el préstamo solicitado comprará materiales de costura como telas, hilos, blondas entre otros.
texts.en:
Doris, 51, is married to Tito, a construction worker and the father of her two children. 
She works hard so she can offer her children the best and so they never lack anything. She lives in her own home which was built with the help of her husband. 
Doris is a seamstress who makes all types of clothing such as polo shirts, blouses, skirts, shorts etc. 
She works out of her home where she has a specific area to display her garments. She started doing this work by studying at an vocational education center and investing her own capital to pay for her studies. 
Once she had the precise technical knowledge she purchased sewing machines and materials. This is how she first started in this business. 

She has been working as a seamstress for over six years. This has allowed her to be known among her clients for her quality and innovation with her clothes. 
She considers this work profitable since with her earnings she can help her husband with the household expenses and give more comfort to her children. 

She tells us that before starting this work she had many economic problems. This is why she hopes to keep growing and turning herself into a prosperous businesswoman. 

At this time she is asking for a 1,000 soles [$400] loan. She is very happy to be receiving financial support and in this way will expand her business. 

With this loan she will buy sewing materials such as fabric, thread, lace etc.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Anesa

texts.en:
This is Anesa, 35, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is a single parent and she has three children. She manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Anesa operates an accessories retail business. What she basically does is buy accessory items from wholesalers and sell them per piece/pack, for a profit. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 (Philippine Pesos) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of accessory products, to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Anesa hopes to have her own stall and dreams that her children will have a good life and future. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for different accessories like pony tails, coin purses, bonnets, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es: Claudio, de 59 años de edad casado. Él es originario del departamento de Chinandega, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. La actividad económica de Claudio  es vender productos varios que consisten en venta de comino, pimienta, canela, romero, anís, cardamomo, orégano, clavo de olor entre otros como leche, maní ya que él es propietario de 50 cabezas de ganado producto que vende en una comarca de Chinandega al mayor y al detalle.  Negocio que está ubicado en su casa de habitación, tiene varios años  de desempeñarse en dicho negocio. Anteriormente pertenecía a un G.S. el cual ahora tenían un buen record crediticio cumplidores con las fechas de pago sin atraso alguno,  él solicita por primera vez individual viendo que su negocio ha incrementado, por lo tanto el financiamiento lo necesita para la compra de productos varios
texts.en:
Claudio, 59, is married and is originally from the administrative division of Chinandega, which is located in the western region of the country. 

Claudio makes a living selling various products which consist of cumin, pepper, cinnamon, rosemary, anise, cardamom, oregano, cloves, and other things such as peanuts and milk, since he is the owner of 50 heads of cattle which is a product that he sells both wholesale and individually in a region of Chinandega. 

His business is located in the home where he lives. He has been performing this work for several years. Previously, he belonged to a Solidarity Group which now has a good credit record since they have complied with the payment deadlines without ever falling behind. Now he is requesting an individual loan for the first time seeing as how his business has increased, and thus he needs financing for the purchase of various products.

loans.use: to buy spice products such as: anise, rosemary, cloves, allspice, pepper, oregano, peanuts, and other products

loans.name: Maciely

texts.es:
Maciely, de 25 años esta casada con René y junto a él tiene 2 hijos pequeños, con quienes vive en su casa propia la cual lograron construir con el fruto de su esfuerzo .Actualmente Maciely  tiene como actividad principal la venta de abarrotes en general tales como  accesorios del hogar, arroz, azúcar, leche , bebidas, embutidos entre otros. Su bodega está instalada en la parte delantera de su casa ubicada en una zona estratégica de su comunidad. Lleva ya 2 años con esta actividad y cuenta con la ayuda incondicional de su cónyuge y se siente feliz de poder compartir un negocio que beneficie a su familia.Le gusta su trabajo pues le permite disponer de su tiempo para realizar otras actividades del hogar, este negocio le genera buenas ganancias ya que siempre hay clientes interesados en su productos además vende al por mayor a los minoristas que también tiene como clientes. Maciely tiene muchas ganas de seguir adelante y a su vez expandir su negocio hasta convertirse en una gran empresaria en la región. 
En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles por tanto agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, ella por su parte se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de abarrotes y artículos de primera necesidad como arroz, pan, huevos, leche, azúcar, aceite y otros productos que le permitan seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Maciely, 25, is married to René and they have two small children. They live in their own house which they built with the fruit of their labor. 

Currently Maciely sells groceries such as home goods, rice, sugar, milk, drinks, sausages etc. 

Her small store is located in the front part of her house which is located in a strategic zone in her community. 

She has been doing this work for two years and counts on the unconditional help from her spouse. She is happy to be able to share a business that helps the family. 

She likes her work since it gives her the flexibility to be able to do other activities around the house. 

This business has generated good profits since there are always clients interested in her products. She also sells whole sale to the retailers. 
Maciely wants to keep moving ahead and in the future expand her business and become a big businesswoman in the region. 

At this time she is asking for a 1,000 soles [$400] loan. She is thankful for all the people who make her loan possible in order to continue with her objectives. She is committed to paying her installments in a timely manner. 

With the loan she will buy a large quantity of groceries and staples such as rice, bread, eggs, milk, sugar, oil and other products that will allow her to keep working.

loans.use: to buy groceries and household goods.

loans.name: Abdul Hameed

texts.en:
Mr. Abdul Hameed is 48 years old. He runs a small shoe shop in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is the only source of income for his family. He is a responsible father of three children who all attend school. His wife is a responsible housewife.
